content:
べんきょう〔勉強〕
〈名〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. (Hard)work:(=する) to work hard

content.content: 試験か近いので皆勉強している
The examination is at hand, and they are all working hard―(と言うよりも普通は)―hard at work
平生勉強しておけば試験前にあわてることはない
If you work hard at other times, you will not have to get flurried before the examinations.
君はいつ来て見ても勉強している
I always find you hard at work.
お兄さんは相変わらずお勉強ですか
Is your brother working as hard as ever?
ますます勉強です
He is working harder than ever.
君は勉強が過ぎる
You work too hard―overwork yourself.
あまり勉強すると死ぬぞ
If you work too hard, you will die―(を単文にすれば)―You will work yourself to death.
あまり勉強して病気にでもなるな
You must not make yourself ill by working too hard―(を縮めて)―work yourself ill.
彼はあまり勉強して肺病になった
He has worked himself into consumption.
勉強も程にするがよい
You should work in moderation―use moderation in working.
君は年百年中勉強ばかりしていないで日曜だけでも遊ぶがよい
Instead of working away every day of the year, you ought to amuse yourself at least on Sunday.
僕は学力が足らないから勉強で補うのだ
I must work hard to make up for my want of ability.
必死と勉強してやっと皆について行ける
I can barely keep up with the others by working for dear life.
よく勉強してよく遊べ
Work while you work, and play while you play―Work with all your might, and play with all your heart.
子どもに勉強ばかりさせて遊ばせないとばかになる
“All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.”
(試験だから)遊びを止めて勉強だ
Play must give place to work.

content: 2. Study:(学問の意味なら)one's studies:(=する) to study (English); to prosecute one's studies; to con over (one's lesson)

content.content: 君はいつ来て見ても勉強している
I always find you at your studies―at your books.
この子は勉強が嫌いで困る
He can not get over his dislike to study.
試験が勉強の刺激となることは争われぬ事実である
There is no denying the fact that examinations give an impetus to study.
勉強の妨げ
a hindrance to study
遊ぶのもよいが勉強の妨げにならぬように
Pleasure must not interfere with your studies.
毎日お門を通るけれどもお勉強のお邪魔になるかと思うてお寄りせぬ
I pass your door every day, but I do not look in, lest I should disturb your study―disturb you in your studies.
彼は勉強に余念無い
He is absorbed in his studies.
一心不乱に勉強している
He is intent on his studies.
勉強に一心だから余の事を考える暇が無い
He is too intent on his studies to think of anything else.
学生の主に勉強するのは英語と数学だ
Students devote most of their time to the study of English and mathematics.
働くには早朝勉強には深更
Morning for work, and night for study.

content: 3. Labour:(=する) to labour

content.content: 彼はあのように勉強したから成功するのは当然だ
He ought to succeed after such labours.
せっかく勉強したのに失敗した
He has failed after all his labours.
あの人は勉強が道楽だ
He loves labour for labour's sake.
勉強したかいがあった(労して効あり)
My labours are crowned with success.

content: 4. (Close) application:(=する) to apply oneself to (the study of English, etc.)

content.content: 彼は孜々汲々として英語を勉強した
He applied himself closely to the study of English.
彼は勉強一つで学者になったのだ
He has made himself a scholar by dint of application―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Close application has made him a scholar.

content: 5. Diligence; industry:(=する) to be diligent; to be industrious

content.content: 彼は学問を勉強する
He is diligent in his studies.
僕の誇るところは勉強の一点である
Diligence is the only merit I lay claim to.
彼は勉強一つで成功したのだ
He has succeeded by sheer diligence―by dint of industry.
勉強したかいがあった
My diligence is rewarded.
僕は学力が足りないから勉強で補うのだ
I must make up by diligence for my want of ability.

content: 6. Perseverance:(=する)to persevere

content.content: 勉強すれば成功する
Persevere, and you will succeed.
勉強しないと失敗するぞ
Persevere, or your will fail.
勉強さえすればひと通りの英語は三年で修められる
If you would only persevere in your efforts, you might master plain English in three years.
彼は勉強ずくで成功したのだ
He has succeeded by dint of perseverance.

content: 7. Efforts

content.content: 忍耐して勉強すれば成功する
If you will persevere in your efforts, you will succeed.
無理な勉強は長く続かぬ
Violent efforts will not last long.

content:
8. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 時日が切迫しているから勉強せにゃならぬ
As time presses, I must make the most of my time.

content:
9. 
〈学生言葉〉Grind; cram; swot:(=する) to grind; to cram; to swot

content.content: しきりに勉強する、こつこつ勉強する
to grind away―hammer away―peg away―plod away―pound away―(at English)
試験準備に勉強する
to grind for an examination―cram for an examination―read up for an examination
君のは試験勉強だ
You are an examination-grinder―a crammer.

content: 10. (=商人の勉強するのは)to sell cheap

content.content: せいぜい勉強致しますからどうぞお買い下さい
We sell as cheap as we can, so you will please give us your custom.
あの店はなかなか勉強する
They sell right cheap at that shop.

content: 〈形〉(=な)studious (person); diligent (student); industrious (worker); hard-working (man); assiduous (attendant); sedulous (care, etc.)

べんきょうか〔勉強家〕
〈名〉A studious person; a diligent student; an industrious worker; a hard-working man; a hard-worker:(学生言葉では)a hard-grinder; a swot

へんきん〔返金〕
〈名〉Repayment; refundment:(=する) to repay; to refund

へんげ〔変化〕
〈名〉A goblin; a hobgoblin; a spectre; a ghost

content:
へんけい〔変形〕
〈名〉
1. Transformation; metamorphosis:(=する) to be transformed, be metamorphosed (into something else)

content.content: 毛虫が蝶に変形する
A caterpillar is transformed into―metamorphosed into―a butterfly.

content: 2. (変形したもの)a variety:(動植物の変形)a monster

べんけい〔弁慶〕
〈固名〉Yoshitsune's devoted follower; a model of fidelity and prowess; one's “fidus Achates”

content.content: 弁慶の七つ道具
Benkei's paraphernalia
弁慶の泣きどころ
Benkei's vulnerable point―“the heel of Achilles”
弁慶の立往生
Benkei's last stand
弁慶の溜め涙
a torrent of long-stored tears
内弁慶の外味噌
He is “a lion at home, a mouse abroad.”
蔭弁慶
He is invincible in peace, invisible in war―“A cock is valiant on his own dunghill.”

べんけいじま〔弁慶縞〕
〈名〉Checks; checkers; chequers

content:
へんけん〔偏見〕
〈名〉A prejudice; a biassed view:(=ある) prejudiced; biassed

content.content: 君は偏見がある
You have prejudices―You are prejudiced―You look through coloured spectacles.
彼は何事についても偏見を懐いている
He holds biassed views on every subject―looks at everything through coloured spectacles.
(殊に)キリスト教に対して偏見を懐いている
He has a prejudiced against Christianity―He is prejudiced against Christianity.
僕の偏見かも知れぬがどうしてもこの人を信用する気になれぬ
I may be prejudiced, but I can not bring myself to trust this man.

content:
へんげん〔変幻〕
〈名〉Sudden transformation

content.content: 変幻自在
Protean―versatile.
変幻の妙を尽す
to play the Proteus
変幻極まり無し
It is Protean.
変幻出没する
to appear and disappear (like a phantom)

content:
へんげん〔片言〕
〈名〉One side of a quarrel; an ex-parte statement

content.content: 片言を信ずべからず
One must not credit one side of the story―Consider both sides of the question―“Look on both sides of the shield.”

へんげんせいはつ〔片舷斉発〕
〈名〉Firing a broadside:(=する) to fire a broadside; to deliver a broadside

content:
へんげんせきご〔片言隻語〕
〈名〉(Not) a word; (not) a syllable

content.content: 片言隻語を漏らさず
without omitting a single word
片言隻語苟{いやしく}もすべからず
Breathe not a syllable of it!

content:
へんげんほう〔片舷砲〕
〈名〉A broadside

content.content: 片舷砲を一斉射撃する
to fire a broadside―deliver a broadside

content:
べんご〔弁護〕
〈名〉
1. Defence (of one's client); plea (for one's life or liberty); justification (for one's action); advocacy (of a cause); vindication (of a doctrine, etc.):(=する) to defend (one's client); to plead (one's case―for the prisoner's life or liberty―in favour of the prisoner); to justify (one's action); to advocate (a cause); to vindicate (a doctrine); to stand up for (the unfortunate); to take up the cudgel for (one's friend, etc.)

content.content: 弁護士が被告のために弁護する

A lawyer defends his client―conducts the defence―pleads his case―(刑事なら)―pleads for the prisoner―pleads for his life or liberty―(民事なら)―pleads for the defendant―pleads in favour of the defendant―makes out a case for the defendant―appears for the defendant.
原告の弁護は誰、被告の弁護は誰ですか
Who appears for the plaintiff? And who appears for the defendant?
事件は弁護の余地なし
The case is indefensible―The case admits of no defence.
人やその行動の弁護のために口を開きまたは筆を執る
to speak or write in defence of a person or his conduct
彼は友人の弁護した
He defended his friend―(口上でなら)―spoke in defence of his friend―(紙上でなら)―wrote in his defence.
彼は自分の行為を弁護した
He justified his own action―(口上でなら)―spoke in justification of his own action(紙上でなら)―wrote in justification of his own action.
先方のひどいやり方が僕の方で断然たる処置をとったことの弁護となる(無意志の弁護)
His doings will justify decisive measures on my part.
そんな理由では君の暴行の弁護にはならぬ
Such reasons will not justify your violence.
彼の動機が(好いから)彼の行動の弁護となる
His motive pleads in his favour.
日本は有色人種の弁護の任に当たるのが当然である
Japan ought to stand up for the coloured races.
彼は先生のことを悪く言う者があると肌脱ぎになって弁護する
He takes up the cudgel for his teacher.
(天道是か非かと言う者に対して)天道を弁護する
to “justify the ways of God to man”

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君の行動については世間の誤解の無いように僕が弁護しておこう
I will set your conduct in a proper light―set you right with the public.
この事件は(理否曲直が明らかだから)弁護を要さぬ
The case can stand on its own merits.
弁護術
forensic eloquence
弁護料
a retaining-fee―a retainer
弁護委任状
a letter of attorney―a warrant of attorney

へんこう〔偏好〕
〈名〉A partiality (for things Japanese, etc.)

content:
へんこう〔変更〕
〈名〉Alteration; change; modification; departure:(=する) to make alterations; to alter (the arrangement); to change (the organization); to modify (the rates); to depart from (a plan, etc.)

content.content: (時間はこう決めたが)変更はご随意です
You may make any alterations you please.
変更の都度ご報知下さい
You will apprise me of every alteration you make.
この規則は変更ができぬ
The rule admits of no alteration.
始め立てた計画を中途で変更するものでない
You should not depart from your original plan.
会社の組織を変更して株式会社にした
The firm has been changed into a joint-stock company.
会場を青年会館に変更す
The place of meeting is altered to the Y. M. C. A. Hall.

content:
べんこう〔弁口〕
〈名〉Power of speech; eloquence

content.content: 彼は弁口が達者だ
He has a fluent tongue―the gift of the gab.

content:
べんごし〔弁護士〕
〈名〉A lawyer; an advocate; a limb of the law:(英国にては)a barrister:(英国にて法律事務所を持って訴訟代理を引受ける代務弁護士、法務弁護士)an attorney:(英国の事務弁護士)a solicitor:(総称)the bar

content.content: 裁判官と弁護士(の総称)
the bench and the bar
弁護士は法廷で弁論する
A lawyer pleads in court.
弁護士を業とする
to practise law―practise as a lawyer―wear the gown
弁護士業
the practice of law―the legal profession―the law―the bar
弁護士になる
to become a lawyer―enter the law―be called to the bar
弁護士試験
the lawyer's examination―the examination for the bar
弁護士試験を受ける(に及第する、に落第する)
to sit for (pass―fail in)the lawyer's examination
彼は弁護士試験の準備をしている
He is studying for the bar―reading for the bar.
彼は弁護士の教育を受けた
He was educated for the law―bred to the law.
弁護士の免許を受ける
to take a lawyer's licence―(英国にては)―be called to the bar―(米国にては)―be admitted to the bar
彼は弁護士の免状を取って開業した
He took a licence and set up as a lawyer―established himself as a lawyer.
開業弁護士
a practising lawyer―a legal practitioner
弁護士を依頼する
to retain a lawyer
弁護士の依頼人
a client
弁護士の依頼料(弁護料)
a retaining-fee―a retainer
弁護士は依頼人の秘密を守る
A professional secret is sacred.
弁護士が依頼人の秘密をあばく
A lawyer discloses a professional secret.
弁護士には同業者間の礼がある
There is professional etiquette among the lawyers.
弁護士の鑑定を乞う
to consult a lawyer―take legal advice
あの弁護士は少しも法律を知らぬ
That lawyer is no lawyer.
もぐり弁護士
an unlicenced lawyer―a hole-and-corner lawyer―a pettifogger
弁護士会
the Law Association

content:
べんごにん〔弁護人〕
〈名〉(=法廷の弁護人)The counsel (in court) ［注意］単複共に同形。

content.content: 相手方弁護人
the opposing counsel
官選弁護人
the counsel designated by the court

へんさ〔偏差〕
〈名〉Deflection (of the compass)

へんさ〔編者〕
〈名〉The compiler (of a book)

へんさい〔変災〕
〈名〉A disaster; a calamity

content:
へんさい〔返済〕
〈名〉Payment; repayment:(=する) to pay (one a debt); to repay (a debt)

content.content: 返済は僕が保証する
I will see you paid―I will guarantee payment.
ご返済無くば不得止訴えます
If you will not pay me, I shall be obliged to proceed against you.
元利共悉皆御返済を願います
You must pay me principal and interest.

へんざい〔遍在〕
〈名〉Omnipresence (of God); ubiquity (of error):(=する) to be omnipresent; to be ubiquitous

content:
べんさい〔弁才〕
〈名〉Oratorical talent; wit

content.content: 彼は弁才が有る
He is witty.

content:
べんさい〔弁済〕
〈名〉Payment; repayment; discharge; acquittance:(=する) to pay, repay, discharge, acquit, satisfy (a debt)

content.content: 負債を弁済する
to pay a debt―discharge a debt―acquit a debt―satisfy a debt―meet one's liabilities

content:
へんさん〔編纂〕
〈名〉Compilation:(=する) to compile (a book); to edit (materials)

content.content: この本は種々の本から編纂したものだ
This book is compiled from various sources―The book is a compilation from various sources.
編纂者
the compiler
編纂物
a compilation
編纂部
the editorial department
編纂部員
the editorial staff

へんし〔変死〕
〈名〉An unnatural death; a violent death:(=する) to die an unnatural death; to die by violence; to be killed by an accident

content:
へんし〔片時〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: へんじ〔片時〕

content:
へんじ〔変事〕
〈名〉An accident; an emergency; a calamity; a disaster

content.content: 変事が起こる
An accident happens―A disaster takes place.
変事があったため汽車が延着した
Owing to an accident, the train is behind time.

content:
へんじ〔片時〕
〈名〉A moment

content.content: 片時も早く
There is not a moment to be lost.
片時も忘れぬ
I never forget it for a moment.

content:
へんじ〔返事〕
〈名〉An answer; a reply; a rejoinder:(=する) to answer (a person or his question or letter); to reply (to a remark) to give an answer; to make a reply; to rejoin

content.content: いつお返事を下さいますか
When will you give me your answer?―When shall I have your answer?
明日お返事を致します
I will give you an answer―You shall have an answer―tomorrow.
いつまでにお返事をすればよろしいのですか
When shall I give an answer?
まだ何の返事も無い
I have received no answer.
尋ねても返事が無い
There was no reply―He made no reply―to my question.
返事の無いのは承知のうち
“Silence gives consent.”
手紙を出しておいたからそのうちに返事があるだろう
I have written to him, so I shall hear from him before long.
手紙をやったがまだ返事が無い
I have written to him, but I have not heard from him in reply.
(お手紙の)返事を貰って参るのですか
Shall I bring back an answer?―wait for an answer?
返事を貰って来るのだ
You must bring back an answer.
返事を貰うに及ばぬ
No answer is needed.
ゆっくり考えて返事をするがよい
You may think over the matter before giving your answer.
返事を待つ
to wait for an answer―listen for a reply
御返事待上候
A waiting the pleasure of your answer―Please oblige me with an early answer―R. S. V. P.(=r?pondez s'il vous pla?t).
彼は返事を聞かずに行ってしまった
He was off without waiting to hear my answer.
手紙の返事を出しておこう
I must answer his letter.
右御返事申上候(と書き終るところを英文にては筆頭に)
In answer to your letter,―In reply to your inquiry,―I beg to inform you that...(と書き始める).

content:
べんし〔弁士〕
〈名〉
1. The speaker, the orator (on the platform)

content.content: 言責弁士にあり
The responsibility for the statement lies with the speaker―The speaker is responsible for the statement.
弁士行き悩む
The speaker breaks down.
弁士を引込ませる
to hiss down the speaker
活動の弁士
a kinema interpreter

へんしつ〔変質〕
〈名〉Degeneration:(=する) to degenerate

content:
べんしゃ〔弁者〕
〈名〉An eloquent speaker; a good talker; a glib talker

content.content: 彼は弁者だ
He is a good talker―He has a fluent tongue―He has the gift of the gab.

へんしゅ〔変種〕
〈名〉A variety (of a plant); a monster (of a flower, etc.)

へんしゅ〔騙取〕
〈名〉Swindle:(=する) to swindle (money from or out of a person―a person out of his money); to defraud (a man of his property); to obtain (money) by fraud; to obtain (money) under false pretences

content:
へんしゅう〔編輯〕
〈名〉Editing:(=する) to edit (a journal or a magazine)

content.content: この新聞は編輯ぶりが気が利いている
The paper is smartly got up.

へんしゅう〔扁舟〕
〈名〉A skiff

content:
へんしゅういん〔編輯員〕
〈名〉The editorial staff

content.content: 僕は編集員だ
I am on the editorial staff.
彼は東京新聞の編集員をしたことがある
He has been on a Tokyo paper.

へんしゅうきょく〔編輯局〕
〈名〉The editorial office

へんしゅうちょう〔編輯長〕
〈名〉The chief editor

へんしゅうにん〔編輯人〕
〈名〉An editor

へんしゅうぶ〔編輯部〕
〈名〉The editorial department

へんしょ〔返書〕
〈名〉An answer (to a letter)

content:
べんじょ〔便所〕
〈名〉The water-closet (W. C.―と略す); the privy; the lavatory; the back-house; the necessary (house):(学校、病院などのは)the latrine:(米国にては)the toilet-room:(こっけいに言えば)my aunt

content.content: 便所へ行く
to obey the calls of nature
便所へ行きたいと言った
He pleaded necessity of nature.
便所があいているか
Is W. C. vacant?
便所はふさがっている
W. C. is occupied.
(人の家へ行って)便所はどこですか
Where can I wash my hands?
(食事前などに主人が気を利かして)便所へ行きたくないか(と聞く)
Don't you want to wash your hands?
共同便所
a public latrine―a street lavatory

content:
へんしょう〔変症〕
〈名〉Development:(=する) to develop (into something)

content.content: 流行性感冒は肺炎に変症する
Influenza develops into pneumonia.

content:
べんしょう〔弁償〕
〈名〉Compensation; indemnification; reparation:(=する) to compensate (a loss―for a loss―one for a loss); to indemnify (one for a loss); to repair (a loss); to make reparation for (a loss); to make up for (a loss); to make good (a loss)

content.content: 損害を弁償する
to compensate (for) a loss―repair a loss―make reparation for a loss―make up for a loss―make good a loss
ご損をかけたら弁償します
I will compensate you―indemnify you―for any loss you may sustain.
ご損の弁償としてこれを取って戴きたい
You must accept this present in compensation for your loss.
こわしたら君に弁償させる
If you break it, you must make good the loss―I will put it to your account.

content:
へんじょうする〔返上する〕
〈他動〉To return, give back (to the Imperial Court)

content.content: 位記を返上する
to forfeit one's honours
(悪口なら)利息をつけて返上する
I can pay back with interest.
彼はそんなことを言ったか、その悪口なら熨斗をつけて返上する

大阪は水運の便利が好い

She is carrying a crowd of sail ［canvas］―under a crowd of sail ［canvas］―carrying a press of sail ［canvas］―under a press of sail ［canvas］

(暴風の時)帆を掛けずに走る

帆をたたむ

船を増す

帆をつめる
to shorten sail―take in sail
帆を縮める

帆を絞る

帆が風を孕む

船が帆に風を孕んで走る

to turn one's steps―bend one's steps―direct one's steps―toward a place

content:
ほう〔報〕
〈名〉A report; (a piece of) news; information; intelligence; tidings

content.content: 報に接する
to hear news―receive intelligence―receive information
英国に激震ありとの報に接せり
Information has been received that there has been a severe earthquake in England.
親病気という報に接した
I have received intelligence of―heard of―learned of―my father's illness.
親病気の報に接して心配した
I was concerned at the news of my father's illness.
病気全快の報に接して悦んだ
I rejoiced at the news of his recovery.
誰が親病気の報をもたらしたか
Who brought intelligence of your father's illness?
ドイツ開戦せりとの報があった
It was reported that Germany had declared war―Germany was reported to have declared war.
河川氾濫の報諸方より来る
Floods are reported from various places.
ご安着の上は早速ご一報下さい
Please write and let me know as soon as you arrive.

content:
ほう〔方〕
〈名〉
1. (=方向)a direction:(談話体の代用詞は)way:(前置詞に訳せば)toward

content.content: その人は公園の方へ行った
He was walking in the direction of the park―toward the park.
三艘の船は西の方へ走った
The three ships sailed in a western direction―toward the west―to the westward.
敵は四方八方へ逃げた
The enemy fled in all directions.
ここから東の方に当たって
to the eastward of this―(to the) east of this
京都の東北の方に当たって山がある
There is a mountain (to the) north-east of Kyoto.
はるか東の方に島がある
There is an island far to the eastward―away east―(米国にては)―way east.
本町の方へ行くところだ
I am going in the direction of Honcho―(とは普通言わずに)―I am going Honcho way―(と言う、またその位置次第に)―up Honcho way―down Honcho way.
築地の方へ行って来た
I have been down Tsukiji way.
僕はあちらの方へはめったに行かない
I seldom go down that way.
青山の方へお出でになることがありますか
Do you ever come up Aoyama way?
こちらの方へお出でになったらぜひお立寄り下さい
If you ever come up this way, be sure to look in.
彼はこっちの方へ来る
He is coming toward us―this way.
僕は君と同じ方へ行く
I am going your way.
僕の行く方へ行く人は無いか
Is no one going my way?

content: 2. (=方面)a quarter:(談話体の代用詞は)way

content.content: 公園は市の北の方にある
The park lies in the northern quarter of the city―in the north of the city.
城が町の東の方にある
The castle stands in the east of the town―(町はずれにあれば)―on the east of the town.
人が四方八方から集まって来る
People come flocking from all quarters.
あの人の家は銀座の方だ
He lives down Ginza way.
いや、青山の方だ
No, he lives up Aoyama way.
火事はどっちの方か
Which way is the fire?
浅草の方だ
It is down Asakusa way.

content: 3. (=自他の方)one's side; one's part

content.content: こっちの方が多数だ
The majority is on our side.
君の方が間違っている
The mistake is on your side―It is you who are mistaken.
さあ君の方の話を聞こう
Now let's hear your side of the story.
こちらの方は契約を履行したけれども先方でしない
The contract has been fulfilled on my part, but not on the other part―by the other party.
君の方からそう下から出たら先でも心がとけるだろう
Such condescension on your part will soften his anger.
君の方が無理だ
You are in the wrong.
相手の方に理がある
He is in the right.

content: 4. (=学問の方、商売の方などの方)way(には一定の構文あり)

content.content: 商売の方では彼と何の関係も無い
I have nothing to do with him in the way of business.
彼は学問の方では申分が無い
He leaves nothing to be desired in the way of scholarship.
おしゃべりの方では彼にかなう者は無い
He has no equal in the way of talking―No one can compare with him in the talking line.
彼は読む方は好いが話す方は駄目だ
He is good at reading, but not at speaking―He is a good reader, but a poor speaker.

content: 5. (=進退するものの方)hand(には一定の構文あり)

content.content: 病人は快い方だ
The invalid is on the mending hand―on the mend.
病勢は進む方だ
The disease is on the advancing hand―on the advance.
衰える方だ
It is on the declining hand―on the decline.
物価は上がる方だ
The prices are on the advancing hand―on the advance―on the rise―rising.
下がる方だ
They are on the declining hand―on the decline―on the fall―falling.
収入は増す方だ
The receipts are on the increasing hand―on the increase.
減ずる方だ
They are on the decreasing hand―on the decrease.

content: 6. ［注意］ 比較の「方」には形容詞、副詞の比較級を用いる。

content.content: あれよりこちらが好い
This is better than that―This is the better of the two.
僕は洋服より和服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
恥をかいて生きているよりも死ぬ方がましだ
I would rather die than live in dishonour―I should prefer death to dishonour―I would choose death before dishonour.
彼は学者というよりも文士の方だ
He is more of a writer than a scholar―He is not so much a scholar as a writer.
読むよりも書く方だ
He is a better writer than scholar.
働くよりも遊ぶ方が好きだ
He is more fond of pleasure than work.
病人はどちらかといえば悪い方だ
The invalid is rather worse(than otherwise)―worse, if anything.
どちらかといえば落第の方だ
He will fail as likely as not.
使いをやるよりも君自身で行く方が好くはないか
Hadn't you better go yourself than send?
こりゃ早速始めた方が好かろう
I may as well begin at once.
早い方が好い
The sooner, the better.
入るより出る方が多い
More goes out than comes in.

content:
ほうがい〔法外〕
〈形〉Exorbitant, extortionate, unreasonable(price or charge); immoderate(ambition); inordinate(desires); extravagant (expenditure); abnormal(growth); fabulous(price); enormous(sum of money); preposterous(demands); excessive (politeness, etc.)

content.content: 値が法外だ
The price are exorbitant―extortionate.
法外に取る
They charge exorbitantly.
法外な利を貪る
to make excessive profits―profiteer
骨董は法外な値段で売買するものだ
Curios are bought and sold at fabulous prices―at fancy prices.
法外な要求だ
They make preposterous demands.
彼は法外な望みを懐いている
He cherishes an immoderate ambition―inordinate desires.

content:
ぼうがい〔妨害〕
〈名〉［注意］始め英語を標準とす。
1. Disturbance (of repose):(=する) to disturb (one's repose)

content.content: 安眠を妨害する
to disturb one's repose
(美人が男の)安心を妨害する(気をもませる)
to disturb one's peace of mind
人の勉強を妨害する
to disturb (one in) one's studies
治安を妨害する
to disturb the public peace―break the peace
治安妨害
the disturbance of the public peace―breach of the peace―riot―sedition

content: 2. Interruption (of one's talk):(=する) to interrupt (one's talk―one in one's talk)

content.content: 人の談話を妨害する
to interrupt (one in) one's talk
演説の妨害をする
to interrupt (one in) one's speech
質問して講義を妨害する
to interrupt the lecture with questions
君の質問は講義の妨害になる
You interrupt the lecture with your questions―Your questions interrupt the lecture.
あの木が眺望を妨害する
That tree interrupts the view.

content: 3. Interference (with business):(=する) to interfere with (business)

content.content: 君の質問は講義の妨害になる
Your questions interfere with the lecture.
授業中談話はいかん! 授業の妨害になる
No talking in class! It interferes with the calss-work.
遊ぶのもよいが勉強の妨害にならぬように
Your pleasure must not interfere with your studies.
遊びが仕事の妨害にならぬように
Pleasure must not interfere with business.
職務の妨害にならぬ限りは何をしてもよろしい
You may do anything so long as it does not interfere with your duties.
病気は働きの妨害になる
Illness interferes with one's work.
家族が大勢あると活動の妨害になる
A large family interferes with one's activity.
営業を妨害する
to interfere with one's business
営業妨害
interference with business

content: 4. Prevention (of activity):(=する) to prevent (one from doing something)

content.content: 病気は働きの妨害になる
Illness prevents one from working.
身体の弱いのが活動の妨害となった
The weakness of his constitution prevented him from taking an active part in life-business―prevented his activity.

content: 5. A hindrance (to success):(=する) to hinder (success―one from succeeding)

content.content: いろいろの困難があって目的遂行の妨害となった
Difficulties hindered me from accomplishing my purpose.
この困難が成功を妨害する
This difficulty hinders success―This difficulty is a hindrance to success.
外部の干渉は事業の進行を妨害する
Outside interference hinders―is a hindrance to―the progress of the work.
病気は勉強の妨害となる
Illness is a hindrance to study.
身体の弱いのが活動の妨害となった
The weakness of his constitution proved a hindrance to his activity.
迷信は進歩の妨害である
Superstition is a hindrance to progress.
進歩の妨害物
a hindrance to progress
遊び好きなのは立身の妨害になる
Love of pleasure is a hindrance to advancement.
寒気は発育を妨害する
Cold hinders growth―Cold is a hindrance to growth.
発育の妨害物
a hindrance to growth
事がなんの妨害も無く運んだ
The matter proceeded without let or hindrance.

content: 6. An impediment (to progress):(=する) to impede (progress)

content.content: 軍隊の行李はその進行を妨害する
The baggage impedes the progress of an army.
外部の干渉は事業の進行を妨害する
Outside interference impedes―is an impediment to―the progress of the work.
進行の妨害物
an impediment to progress
病気は勉強の妨害になる
Illness is an impediment to study.
身体の弱いのが活動の妨害となった
The weakness of his constitution proved an impediment to his activity.
迷信は進歩の妨害である
Superstition is an impediment to progress.
遊び好きなのは立身の妨害になる
Love of pleasure is an impediment to advancement.
逆境は発達を妨害する
Unfavourable circumstances impede development―Adversity is an impediment to development.

content: 7. An obstruction (to traffic):(=する) to obstruct (traffic)

content.content: 通行を妨害する
to obstruct traffic
通行の妨害物
an obstruction to traffic
あの木が眺望を妨害する
That tree obstructs the view―That tree is an obstruction to the view.
眺望の妨害物
an obstruction to the view
河は軍隊の進行を妨害する
Rivers obstruct the progress of an army.
議事の進行を妨害する
to obstruct proceedings
議事進行妨害
obstruction―(米国にては)―filibustering

content: 8. An obstacle (to success―in the way of success):(=する) to stand in the way of (success)

content.content: この困難が成功を妨害する
This difficulty is an obstacle to success―This difficulty stands in the way of success.
君の成功を妨害するものは無い
There is no obstacle to your success―There is no obstacle in the way of your succees―There is nothing in the way of your success―Nothing stands in the way of your success.
人の成功を妨害する
to stand in the way of one's success―throw an obstacle in the way of one's success
遊び好きなのは立身の妨害になる
Love of pleasure is an obstacle to advancement.

content: 9. A bar (to progress―in the way of success):(=する) to bar (the way―progress―one from activity)

content.content: 通行を妨害する
to bar the way―bar the path
接近を妨害する
to bar access (to a person)
出入りを妨害する
to bar egress and ingress
迷信は進歩を妨害する
Superstition is a bar to progress.
この困難が成功を妨害する
This difficulty is a bar in the way of our success.
外部の干渉は事業の進行を妨害する
Outside interference bars―is a bar to―the progress of the work.
身体の弱いのが活動を妨害した
The weakness of his constitution barred him from activity.
身分の違いが二人の交際の妨害となった
The difference of rank barred―was a bar to―their intercourse.
我が大望の妨害は彼一人である
He is the only bar to my ambition.

content: 10. A barrier (to progress―between rich and poor)

content.content: この困難が成功の妨害である
This difficulty is a barrier to our success.
身分の違いが二人の交際の妨害となった
The difference of rank proved a barrier to their intercourse―Rank stood a barrier between the two.
我が大望の妨害は彼一人である
He is the only barrier to my ambition.

content: 11. A check (to motion or speed):(=する) to check (motion or speed)

content.content: 雪が汽車の進行を妨害した
The snow checked the progress of the train.
これより都まで行く途中に我が軍の進軍を妨害する要塞が無い
There are no fortresses on the road to check our march to the capital.

content: 12. A clog (to a person―on his movement or activity)

content.content: 女や子どもは活動の妨害になる
Women and children are a clog to an active man―a clog on a man's activity.

content: 13. A drag (to a person―on his movement or activity)

content.content: 彼の身分が出世の妨害になった
His social position was a drag to him in rising in the world―a drag on his career.

content: 14. Counterwork:(=する) to counterwork, work against (some cause)

content.content: 人の事業を妨害する
to counterwork one's cause―work against one's cause
船の進行を妨害する
to retard the progress of a ship
借金のために運動の自由を妨害された
I was hampered by debts.
財政困難のために活動を妨害された
I was handicapped by pecuniary difficulties.
人の計画を妨害する(反対する)
to oppose―set oneself against―set one's face against―a scheme
彼を妨害するな
Do not cross his wishes!―thwart his purpose!―put a spoke in his wheel!
日米の国交を妨害せんとする国がある
A certain power is trying to destroy the national friendship between Japan and America.

content:
16. 
〈以上の共通点〉

content.content: 勉強を妨害する
to disturb (one in) one's studies―interfere with one's studies
勉強の妨害
a hindrance to study―an impediment to study
授業を妨害する
to interrupt the lecture―interfere with the class-work
眺望を妨害する
to obstruct the view―interrupt the view
通行を妨害する
to obstruct traffic―bar the way
進行を妨害する
to hinder progress―impede progress―bar progress―retard the progress of a ship
進行の妨害
a hindrance to progress―an impediment to progress―a bar to progress
成功の妨害となる
to hinder success―bar success―stand in the way of one's success―prove an obstacle in the path of one's success
成功の妨害
a hindrance to success―an impediment to success―an obstacle to success―a bar to success―a barrier to success
活動の妨害となる
to interfere with one's activity―prevent one's activity―hinder one's activity―impede one's activity―hamper one's activity―handicap one's activity―bar one from activity
活動の妨害
a hindrance to one's activity―an impediment to one's activity―a clog on one's activity―a drag on one's activity
身体の弱いのが活動の妨害となった
The weakness of his constitution proved a hindrance to his activity―proved an impediment to his activity―barred him from activity.
立身の妨害
a hindrance to one's advancement―an impediment to one's advancement―a bar to one's advancement―a barrier to one's advancement―a clog on one's career―a drag on one's career
病気が働きの妨害になる
Illness interferes with one's work―prevents one from working.
大望の妨害
an obstacle to one's ambition―a bar to one's ambition―a barrier to one's ambition
発育(発達)を妨害する
to hinder―impede―check―growth or development
軍隊の行進を妨害する
to impede―obstruct―bar―check―the progress of an army
身分の違いが二人の交際の妨害となった
The difference of rank proved a bar to their intercourse―proved a barrier to their intercourse―Rank stood a barrier between the two.
外部の干渉は事業の進行を妨害する
Outside interference hinders the progress of the work―impedes the progress of the work―bars the progress of the work.
彼を妨害するな
Do not stand in his way!―cross his wishes! thwart his purpose!

青山は方角が違う

方角が悪いから引越しを見合わした

どの方角もさがして見た

さがさない方角は無い

東京は慣れないところへ行くと方角がわからなくなる

content:

content.content: 幇間をする
to wear motley

ほうがん〔包含〕
〈名〉Inclusion; comprehension:(=する) to include, comprise, embrace (this and that); to comprehend (many or all)

ほうがん〔包岩〕

content:
ぼうかん〔坊間〕
〈副〉In the streets; abroad

content.content: 坊間に伝わる
It is noised abroad―rumoured abroad―in everybody's mouth.
坊間の噂
a current rumour―a flying rumour
坊間にひさぐ
It is sold everywhere―to be had anywhere.
坊間の書と選を異にす
The book is not to be classed with the books sold everywhere.

content:

content.content: 防寒具
protections against cold
防寒設備がよく整っている
Protection against cold is in good trim.

ぼうかんしゃ〔傍観者〕

content:
ぼうかんする〔傍観する〕
〈自動〉To look on; to be a spectator

content.content: 袖手傍観する
to look on with folded arms―look on unconcernedly―look on with indifference―to be a mere spectator―an unconcerned spectator―an idle spectator
人の難儀するのを袖手傍観するに忍びぬ
I can't bear to be an idle spectator when others are in distress―to look unconcernedly on others' distress.

content:

content.content: 天下の形成を望観する

content:
ほうき〔放棄〕
〈名〉Abandonment (of an attempt); abjuration (of faith); renunciation, surrender, disclaimer, waiver (of a right); relinquishment (of a claim); resignation (of a possession):(=する) to abandon, give up (an attempt); to abjure (one's faith); to renounce, surrender, disclaim, waive (a right); to relinquish, resign, forego (a claim); to resign, deliver up, give up (one's possessions); to throw up, fling up (one's office); to throw away (an opportunity); to lay aside (some work)

content.content: 権利を放棄する
to renounce one's rights―surrender one's rights―disclaim one's rights―waive one's rights―relinquish one's claim―resign one's claim―forego one's claim
地位を放棄する
to throw up one's office―fling up one's situation
企図を放棄する
to abandon the attempt―give up the attempt
事業が一か年放棄してある
The work has been laid aside for a year.

ほうき〔法規〕

content:

content:

〈名〉An insurrection; an uprising; a rising:(=する) to rise against the government; to rise in arms; to rise in revolt; to rise in rebellion

content.content: 人民が蜂起している
The people are up―The country is up.
人民の蜂起
a rising of the people
蜂起せる人民
the insurgents

content:
ほうき〔箒〕
〈名〉A broom; a besom

content.content: 箒で掃く
to sweep with a broom
こんな物は箒で掃くほどある
Such articles are to be found by the cartload.
箒の柄
a broomstick

content:
ほうきぼし〔箒星〕
〈名〉A comet

content.content: ほうき星が出る
A comet appears.
昔はほうき星が出ると変乱の兆としたものだ
The appearance of a comet was formerly regarded as a sign of some social disturbance.

content:
ぼうきゃく〔忘却〕
〈名〉Forgotfulness; oblivion:(=する) to forget (anything); to be forgetful of (anything); to be oblivious of (anything); to bury (anything) in oblivion:(わざとなら)to banish (anything)from the mind

content.content: 前後を忘却する
to forget oneself
眠って前後を忘却する

to be dead drunk

to be beside oneself with joy or sorrow
前後を忘却して考え込んでいる
He is in a brown study.
前後を忘却して眺めていた
He was gazing on the scene with rapture―He was rapt in wonder―lost in admiration.
前後を忘却して音楽を聴いていた
He listened to the music with rapt attention.
子どもらは前後を忘却して遊んでいる

たいがいの人は死ぬと世に忘却される
Most names are buried in oblivion.

〈名〉A salary; a stipend; pay; emolument

content.content: 彼は俸給で食っている
He lives on his salary.
百円の俸給で暮らしている
He lives on a salary of 100 yen.
彼は俸給のほかに収入があるか
Has he any income besides his pay?

He must have something besides his pay.
俸給のほかは収入が無い
He has nothing but his pay.
俸給をいくら取るか
What salary does he draw?―What does he get?
二百円の俸給を取る
He draws a salary of 200 yen―gets 200 yen.
彼は五百円の俸給で雇われた
He has been engaged at a salary of―on a salary of―500 yen.
あの学校の先生は俸給が好い、俸給が悪い

俸給が高い、俸給が安い
They are overpaid―underpaid.
俸給を払う

今日は俸給支払日だ
We get paid today.
俸給を上げる、俸給を下げる
to raise one's salary―lower one's salary
俸給は目的にあらず
Emolument is no object with me.

〈名〉A venture; an adventure:(投機的冒険は)a risk; a hazard:(=する) to venture; to make a venture; to run a risk; to run a hazard; to brave a danger; to face a danger; to defy a danger; to dare a danger; to tempt Providence; to fly in the face of Providence

content.content: 一つの冒険をやってみよう
I will make a venture―(投機なら)―run a risk―venture upon a speculation―(一か八かふってみよう、当たって砕けろ)―I'll take my chance―take the chances―chances it―take the risks―risk it.
損をするような冒険はいやだ
I don't like to run the risk of losing.
偉い冒険をやったもんだ

ちと冒険だがやってみよう
It is rather risky―rather hazardous―but I'll try.
生命財産をなげうって冒険する

Run no risks,but keep steady, there is no danger.
無謀な冒険をするな

向こう見ずな冒険をする

冒険積送物

content.content: 娘は奉公している
His daughter is in service.
どこに奉公しているか
In whose service is she?
ある医者のところに奉公している

どこに奉公する

あなたのところにご奉公致したいのです

content:

〈名〉A gale; a hurricane; a storm

content.content: 暴風が吹く
A gale blows―It blows a gale.
暴風が吹きすさんでいる
It is blowing a gale―A storm is raging.
暴風襲来の兆あり
There are signs ［indications］ of a coming storm.
(海上で)暴風に遇う
to be overtaken by a gale―encounter a storm
暴風怒濤を起こす
The gale lashes the sea into fury.
暴風が吹き止む
A gale blows itself out.
暴風の後は快晴
“After a storm comes a calm.”
暴風の虞れあり警戒す
The public is warned of an approaching storm.
暴風警報
a storm warning
暴風信号
a storm signal

content:
ぼうふうう〔暴風雨〕
〈名〉A storm; a tempest; a war ［strife］ of the elements

content.content: 暴風雨襲来の兆あり
There are signs ［indications］ of a coming storm.
暴風雨が起きる
A storm rises―A storm comes on.
暴風雨が吹きすさむ
A storm rages.
暴風雨が極点に達した
The storm is at its height.
暴風雨猛威を極めて襲い来たる
A storm burst on us in all its fury.
海上暴風雨に遭遇す
We were overtaken by a storm―encountered a storm―at sea.
暴風雨鎮静に帰す
The storm has died away―The storm has calmed down―The storm has subsided.
暴風雨のおそれあり警戒す
The public is warned of an approaching storm.
暴風雨警報
a storm warning
暴風雨信号
a storm signal

ぼうふううたい〔暴風雨帯〕
〈名〉A storm zone

content:
ほうふく〔報復〕
〈名〉Revenge; retaliation:(=の)retaliatory

content.content: 報復手段
a retaliatory measure
報復税率
a retaliatory tariff

ほうふく〔法服〕
〈名〉(A judge's or a lawyer's)robe of office; (a priest's)sacerdotal robe

content:
ほうふくぜっとう〔抱腹絶倒〕
〈名〉Convulsion of laughter:(=する)to be convulsed with laughter; to laugh oneself into convulsions; to go off into convulsions; to hold one's side; to split one's sides; to laugh one's bones loose

content.content: あの人はあまりばかなことを言うからときどき抱腹絶倒する
He often throws us into convulsions.
彼は面白いことを言って満座を抱腹絶倒させる
He sets the table in a roar.
実に抱腹絶倒の至りだ
It is simply ridiculous.

ぼうふざい〔防腐剤〕
〈名〉An antiseptic; an aseptic; a preservative

content:
ほうふつ〔彷彿〕
〈形〉
1. (=よく似た)very like (something); closely resembling(something); (to be)much alike, of a kind, of a sort

content.content: いずれも皆彷彿たるものだ
They are all of a sort.

content: 2. (=ぼんやり見える)dim; indistinct; faint

content.content: 水天彷彿青一髪
A faint line marks the dim horizon.

ほうぶつせん〔抛物線〕
〈名〉A parabola

content:
ぼうふら〔孑孑〕
〈名〉The mosquito-larva

content.content: 水にボーフラがわく
The water breeds mosquito-larvae.
盃にボーフラがわきますよ
Your cup is stagnating.

content:
ぼうふりむし〔孑孑虫〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ぼうふら〔孑孑〕

content:
ほうぶん〔法文〕
〈名〉The law

content.content: 法文にあり
It is provided in the law.
法文に無し
There is no provision in the law.

content:
ほうぶん〔邦文〕
〈名〉Japanese

content.content: 英文と邦文と対訳になっている
The English original has its Japanese translation on the opposite page.

content:
ほうへい〔砲兵〕
〈名〉An artilleryman:(集合的に言えば)artillery

content.content: 砲兵中隊
a battery
砲兵大尉
a captain of artillery
砲兵戦
an artillery duel
砲兵科
the artillery arm
砲兵軽重
an artillery train

ほうへいこうしょう〔砲兵工廠〕
〈名〉An ordnance factory; an arsenal

content:
ほうへん〔褒貶〕
〈名〉Praise and censure; opinion

content.content: 彼は世の褒貶にとらわれている
He lives on opinion.
世の褒貶に無頓着だ
He is indifferent to praise or censure.

content:
ほうべん〔方便〕
〈名〉A means; an instrumentality; an expedient; a convenient fiction

content.content: 釈迦は方便を設けて衆生を済度した
Sakyamuni invented fictions to save the world.
嘘も方便
“The end justifies the means.”― “The end sanctifies the means.”
方便の嘘
a white lie―pious fraud

content:
ほうほう〔方法〕
〈名〉A method (of teaching); a way (to learn); a mode (of life); a plan (for escape); a system (of study); a process (of manufacture); (the method of) procedure; means (to an end)

content.content: これが英語研究の最良の方法である
This is the best way to learn English―the most approved method of studying English.
善い方法には違いないが実行し難い
It is a good method, to be sure, but hard to practise.
これは実行し得る方法だ
The plan will work―This is a workable plan.
方法を立てて研究する
to study on system
語学に達するの方法は練習の一あるのみ
The only way to master a language is practice.
この方法は教師の労を省く
The method saves the teacher much trouble.
目的を達する方法を講ずる
to find means to the end―devise ways and means
間違い無い(はずれっこの無い)方法を採った
I adopted an infallible method―resorted to the surest means―took a sure way.
方法よろしきを得れば三年かからぬ
If you proceed in the right way―go about it in the right way―it will not take you three years.
君は方法を誤っている
You proceed in the wrong way―go about it in the wrong way.
ほかに方法が無い
There is no other way―no alternative.

ほうぼう
〈名〉The gurnard; the gurnet

content:
ほうぼう〔方々〕
〈名〉Several places:(副詞に用いれば) in several places; everywhere; here and there; far and near; up and down; from place to place

content.content: 方々探したけれどもどこにもいません
I have looked for him everywhere―hunted for him up and down―but he is nowhere to be seen.
人が方々から集まって来る
People come flocking from far and near.
そういう看板を方々にちょいちょい見受ける
I see the signboard here and there.
あの人ほど方々へ行く人は無い
He is,here, there, and everywhere.
自動車で方々歩き廻った
I went about from place to place in a motor-car.
彼は方々歩いた人だ
He has knocked about the world.
この本は方々の学校で使っている
This book is used in several schools.
方々の医者にかかった
I have consulted several doctors.
方々に火事があった
There were fires in several places―Fires were reported from various quarters.
材料は方々から集めた
The materials have been gathered from various sources.

content:
ほうぼう〔鋒鋩〕
〈名〉The point of a sword

content.content: 鋒鋩を現わす
to show one's genius―One's genius asserts itself

content:
ぼうぼう〔蓬々〕
〈形〉Overgrowing, rank (vegetation)

content.content: 庭は草ぼうぼうだ
The garden is overgrown with weeds―overgrown with rank vegetation.

content:
ぼうぼう〔茫茫〕
〈形〉Vast; boundless

content.content: 茫々たる大洋
the boundless ocean

content:
ぼうぼう〔茫茫〕
〈形〉Vast; boundless

content.content: 茫々たる大洋
the boundless ocean

content:
ほうほうのてい〔這々の体〕
〈名〉Precipitation

content.content: ほうほうのていで逃げ出す
to retreat with precipitation
果てはほうほうのていで逃げ出したという始末さ
The upshot of the matter was, that I had to beat a precipitate retreat.

content:
ほうぼく〔放牧〕
〈名〉Pasturage:(=する) to pasture(cattle); to put (cattle) to pasture; to turn out (a horse) to grass; to leave (a horse) to roam at will

content.content: 馬は放牧してある
The horses are in pasture―at grass―left to roam at will.
放牧場
a pasture

ほうぼく〔芳墨〕
〈名〉Your esteemed letter

content:
ほうまつ〔泡沫〕
〈名〉A bubble

content.content: 人生のはかなきこと泡沫に似たり
Life is a bubble.
泡沫夢幻の世
a transient life
泡沫会社
a bubble company

content:
ぼうまん〔暴慢〕
〈名〉Insolence:(=なる) insolent

content.content: その暴慢無礼恨むべし
Confound his insolence!

ほうみょう〔法名〕
〈名〉A posthumous Buddhist name

ぼうみん〔暴民〕
〈名〉A mob; a mad populace; rioters; insurgents

content:
ほうむる〔葬る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=埋葬する)to bury; to inter; to lay (one) to rest; to lay (one) to sleep; to consign (one's remains) to the grave; to commit (the body) to the earth

content.content: 人が死ぬと死骸は葬られる
When a man dies, his remains are consigned to the grave―committed to the earth.
先祖の墓に葬られる
to be gathered to one's fathers
魚腹に葬られる
to become food for fishes―feed the fishes
闇から闇に葬られる
A child falls still-born―dies in the womb.
事件を闇から闇へ葬ってしまった
The matter was smothered up.

content: 2. (=忘れてしまう)to consign (anything) to oblivion

content.content: 当時鳴らした学者も今は世に葬られてしまった
He was a famous scholar in his day, but has been consigned to oblivion―buried in oblivion.
こんな人間は葬ってしまおう
Let us consign such men to oblivion.
秘密は胸中に葬らん
The secret shall be buried in my bosom.
事件はうやむやのうちに葬られた
The matter was smothered up―hugger-muggered up.

content:
ほうめい〔芳名〕
〈名〉A good name; a good reputation; fair fame

content.content: 芳名を千載に遺す
to immortalize one's name―with immortal fame―achieve an immortality
ご芳名はかねて承っています
I have known you by reputation.

ぼうめい〔亡命〕
〈名〉Flight to foreign parts; self-exile:(=する) to fly to foreign parts; to take refuge in a foreign country; to exile oneself

content:
ぼうめいしゃ〔亡命者〕
〈名〉A fugitive; a refugee; an exile:(殊に)a foreign refugee; a political refugee

content.content: 亡命者を本国官憲に引渡す
to extradite a refugee
亡命者引渡し
extradition of a refugee

ほうめいろく〔芳名録〕
〈名〉A list of acquaintances

content:
ほうめん〔放免〕
〈名〉Release; discharge; acquittal; liberation:(=する) to release (a prisoner); to discharge (one from custody); to acquit (one of the charge); to liberate (a prisoner); to set (a prisoner) at liberty; to set (one) free; to let (one) go; to let (one) off

content.content: 後来を戒めて放免した
They released him after warning him for the future.
彼は無罪放免になった
He has been acquitted (and set at liberty).
満期放免になった
He has been discharged after serving time.

content:
ほうめん〔方面〕
〈名〉A quarter; a direction; a side; a line; a way

content.content: 各方面から問い合わせが来る
Inquiries come from all quarters.
各方面へ人を派した
We have despatched men in all directions.
その方面からは助力を期待しなかった
We did not expect aid from that quarter.
意外な方面から助力を得た
We received aid from an unexpected quarter.
どちらの方面へお出かけですか
In which direction are you going?―Where are you going?
今度は新潟の方面へ出かけます
I am going in the direction of Niigata―I am going to Niigata and neighbourhood.
彼の性格には種々の方面がある
There are many sides to his character.
多方面の人だ
He is a many-sided man―a versatile man.
趣味が多方面だ
He has many-sided interest―a wide sympathy.
卒業生は実業界の各方面に働いている
The graduates are active in all lines of business.
商売の方面では彼と何の関係も無い
I have had nothing to do with him in the way of business.
発明の方面では日本はまだあまり功績は無い
Japan has done little in the way of inventions.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この問題はあらゆる方面から研究しなければならぬ
We must consider the question in all its bearings.
研究が新方面に入る
The study enters upon a new phase.
彼らは種々の方面に働いている
They labour in various spheres of activity.

content:
ほうもう〔法網〕
〈名〉The meshes of the law

content.content: 法網にかかる
to fall into the meshes of the law―fall into the clutches of the law
法網にかからぬようにする
to keep out of the meshes of the law
法網を脱する
to get out of the clutches of the law
法網を潜る
to elude the law―evade the law
彼は巧みに法網を潜る
He is clever at evading the law.

content:
ほうもつ〔宝物〕
〈名〉
1. A treasure

content.content: その手紙は宝物として秘蔵されてある
The letter is kept as a treasure.
重代の宝物
an heirloom

content: 2. (=寺院などに保存する宝物)a relic

ほうもん〔砲門〕
〈名〉A gun-port; a port-hole:(より)a gun

content.content: 砲門を開く
to open fire

content:
ほうもん〔訪問〕
〈名〉A call; a visit:(新聞記者の訪問は)an interview :(=する) to call on (a person at his residence); to make a call; to pay (one) a visit; to look in upon (one); to drop in upon (one); to look (one) up; to beat up one's quarters; to pay one's respects to (a superior):(新聞記者なら)to interview

content.content: 大臣を官邸に訪問す
I called on the Minister at his official residence.
パリに着して日本大使館を訪問した
On arrival in Paris, I went to pay my respects to my flag.
今日は訪問せんならんところがある
I have a call to make―some calls to make.
人を訪問して入らずに名刺を置いて帰る
to leave a card on one
訪問を受ける
to receive a call―have a visit―from some one
妙な人の訪問を受けた
I had a visit from an unexpected person.
新聞記者の訪問を受けた
I was interviewed by a reporter.
(選挙競争に)戸別訪問する
to pay house-to-house visits―canvass from door to door
訪問者
a caller
訪問記者
an interviewer
訪問者を断わる
to deny oneself to callers
今日社長は訪問者を断わって面会しなかった
The President was denied to callers today.

ぼうや〔坊や〕
〈呼掛け名詞〉My boy; sonny

content:
ほうゆう〔朋友〕
〈名〉A friend

content.content: 朋友信あり
Friends should be faithful to each other.
朋友相信ず
Friends should trust each other.
朋友の義を結ぶ
to contract a friendship with some one
朋友の義を破る
to violate the laws of friendship

content:
ほうよう〔包容〕
〈名〉Tolerance:(=する) tolerate (men of different views); to entertain (an enemy) in one's heart

content.content: 彼は人を包容する雅量がある
He has a capacity for tolerance.

ぼうよみ〔棒読み〕
〈名〉Reading (Chinese) without translating

ほうらい〔蓬莱〕
〈名〉The island of perpetual youth

content:
ほうらく〔放楽、法楽〕
〈名〉Amusement; pleasure

content.content: 見るは放楽
The mere sight is a pleasure.

content:
ほうらく〔放楽、法楽〕
〈名〉Amusement; pleasure

content.content: 見るは放楽
The mere sight is a pleasure.

content:
ぼうらく〔暴落〕
〈名〉A sudden fall (in price); a slump; a tumble:(=する) to fall suddenly (in price); to slump; to tumble

content.content: 相場が奔騰暴落する
The prices jump and slump―fluctuate violently―run up and down the gamut.
十円台に暴落した
It has fallen suddenly to 10 yen level.
二割暴落した
It has fallen suddenly by 20 percent.

content:
ほうらくする〔崩落する〕
〈自動〉To collapse; to give way

content.content: 物価が崩落する
The prices drop―The prices sag.

ほうらくのけい〔炮烙の刑〕
〈名〉(An ancient Chinese punishment of) walking a slippery iron rod into the fire

content:
ほうらつ〔放埒〕
〈形〉Dissolute; dissipated; profligate; prodigal; licentious; libertine

content.content: あれは放埒な男だ
He is a dissolute fellow―a loose fish―a sad dog―a rake―a libertine.

ほうらつもの〔放埒者〕
〈名〉A profligate; a prodigal; a debauchee; a rake; a libertine; a loose fish; a sad dog

ほうり〔方里〕
〈名〉A square ri

ほうり〔法理〕
〈名〉The philosophy of law; jurisprudence

content:
ぼうり〔暴利〕
〈名〉Excessive profit; profiteering

content.content: 奸商が暴利をむさぼる
Dishonest merchants make excessive profits―(当世の言葉では)―profiteer
暴利令
a law against profiteering
大地震後に当局者の出した暴利令は時宜を得ておった
The law against profiteering made by the authorities after the great earthquake was well-timed.
暴利者
a profiteer

content:
ほうりがく〔法理学〕
〈名〉Jurisprudence

content.content: 法理学者
a jurist

content:
ほうりき〔法力〕
〈名〉Miracle-working power

content.content: 法力によって助かった
He was saved by a miracle.

content:
ほうりこむ〔抛り込む〕
〈他動〉To throw in

content.content: 河へほうり込む
to throw anything into a river
水夫らが船長を海へほうり込んだ
The sailors threw their captain overboard.
この手紙をほうり込んでくれ
Drop this letter for me.

content:
ほうりだす〔抛り出す〕
〈他動〉To throw out; to fling out

content.content: (勝利を断念して)手の札をほうり出す
to throw up one's cards
馬車からほうり出された
We were shot out of the coach―spilt from the coach.

content:
ほうりつ〔法律〕
〈名〉Law (a law, the law, the laws):(=の) legal

content.content: 法律を守る
to observe the law
法律にしたがう、法律を遵奉する
to obey the law
法律を重んずる
to have a regard for the laws
法律を無視する(眼中法律無し)
They defy the law―set the laws at defiance.
法律に適う、法律に適わぬ
It is good law―bad law.
法律に反する
It is against the law―contrary to the laws.
法律を犯す、法律を破る、法律に違う、法律に背く、法律に触れる
to break the law―infringe the law―violate the law―offend against the law
法律を潜る
to elude the law―evade the law
法律の字句に拘泥する
to adhere to the letter of the law
法律の字句に拘泥してその精神を没却する
to observe the letter, and not the spirit, of the law
法律の字句に拘泥せずしてその精神を取る
to observe the spirit, and not the letter, of the law
法律の裏をかく
to defeat the ends of justice
堂々と法律の裏をかく
to drive a coach-and-six through a new Act of Parliament
法律に照らす
(照らして判決する)to decide on a case according to the law―(照らして処分する)―deal with a criminal according to the law
法律を制定する、法律を立てる
to make a law―enact a law―legislate
法律の規定するところ
It is established by law―ordained by law.
法律を実施する、法律を執行する
to put a law in force―(裁判するの意味なら)―administer justice―deal out justice
法律が実施になる
A law comes into force.
この法律が実施になっている
The law is in force.
法律を励行する
to enforce a law
この法律は厳重に励行されている
The law is enforced to the letter.
法律を実行しないからほごになっている
Want of enforcement makes the law a dead letter―makes the law of no effect.
法律を解釈応用するのが判官の本領である
It is the duty of the judge to interpret and apply the laws.
法律を曲げる
to pervert the law―strain the law―stretch the law
法律に明文あり、明文無し
There is an express provision in the law―no provision in the law.
法律は人を論ぜず
The law has no respect of persons―The law is no respecter of persons.
法律より見れば人は皆同等なり
All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
法律は知らぬで通らぬ
Ignorance is no excuse with the law.
法律に従う国民、法律に従わぬ国民
law-abiding citizens―lawless people
法律の行われる国、法律の行われぬ国
a law-abiding country―a lawless country
殺児を禁ずる法律
a law against infanticide
一定不動の法律
the law of the Medes and Persians
あの人は法律が詳しい
He is learned in the law.
あの弁護士はちっとも法律を知らぬ
That lawyer is no lawyer.
法律ずくで取って見せる
I will have the law of him.
法律事件
a case―a lawsuit
法律事務
law business
法律事務所
a law-office
法律語
a legal term
法律顧問
a legal adviser
法律独案内
one's own lawyer

ほうりつか〔法律家〕
〈名〉A lawyer; a jurist; a jurisconsult

content:
ほうりつがく〔法律学〕
〈名〉Jurisprudence→『

content.content: ほうりつか〔法律家〕

ぼうりや〔暴利屋〕
〈名〉A profiteer

content:
ほうりゃく〔方略〕
〈名〉A plan; a design; a scheme; a stratagem; a manoeuvre

content.content: 方略を定める
to agree upon the plan
方略をめぐらす
to revolve a scheme
(敵の)方略の裏をかく
to baffle a design―baulk a design―defeat a design―foil a design―frustrate a design
方略が図に当たる
The stratagem takes.
方略がはずれる
The stratagem fails.
方略をもって敵の位置を転ぜしむ
to manoeuvre the enemy into (or out of) some position
一般方略
the general plan (of a campaign)
特別方略
special instructions
(武勇戦に対する)方略戦
a general's battle
武勇戦に負けて方略戦に勝つ
to lose a soldier's battle and win a general's battle

content:

〈名〉Strategy:(一つなら)a stratagem

content.content: 謀略をめぐらす
to devise a stratagem
謀略が成功した
The stratagem has taken.
謀略は密なるを尚{たっと}ぶ
Secrecy is the soul of strategy.

to resort to force―appeal to force

〈他動〉
1. (=投げる)to hurl; to fling; to pitch; to throw; to cast; to toss

content.content: 抛り上げる
to toss―toss up

content: 2. (=構わぬ)to neglect; to lay aside; to leave (anything) alone; to let (anything) alone; to let (anything) be

content.content: (かまうな)ほうっておけ
Leave it alone!―Let it alone!―Let it be!―Let her rip!
僕にかまわずにほうっておいてくれ
Leave me alone!―Let me alone!
仕事をほうっておいた
I have neglected my work.
一年間ほうっておいた
I have laid it aside for a year.

You will soon laugh on the wrong side of your month―laugh out of the other corner of your month.

content:
ほえる〔吠える、吼える〕
〈自他動〉To bark (at people); to bay(the moon); (hounds)give tongue, give mouth; (wolves)howl; (lions and tigers)roar

content.content: この犬は人に吠える
This dog barks at people.
犬に吠えられた
I was barked at by a dog.
吠える犬は噛まぬ
Barking dogs do not bite.
喰つく犬は吠えぬ
“Reware of a silent dog and still water.”
能無し犬の高吠え
Braggarts are cowards.
犬が月に向って吠える
A dog bays the moon.
猟犬が鹿を見て吠える
A hound gives mouth―gives tongue.
一犬吠ゆれば万犬
One barking dog sets the whole street barking.
一犬虚を吠ゆれば万犬実を伝う
One dog bays the moon, and the whole street barks in earnest.

content:
ほえる〔吠える、吼える〕
〈自他動〉To bark (at people); to bay(the moon); (hounds)give tongue, give mouth; (wolves)howl; (lions and tigers)roar

content.content: この犬は人に吠える
This dog barks at people.
犬に吠えられた
I was barked at by a dog.
吠える犬は噛まぬ
Barking dogs do not bite.
喰つく犬は吠えぬ
“Reware of a silent dog and still water.”
能無し犬の高吠え
Braggarts are cowards.
犬が月に向って吠える
A dog bays the moon.
猟犬が鹿を見て吠える
A hound gives mouth―gives tongue.
一犬吠ゆれば万犬
One barking dog sets the whole street barking.
一犬虚を吠ゆれば万犬実を伝う
One dog bays the moon, and the whole street barks in earnest.

content:
ほお〔頬〕
〈名〉The cheek

content.content: 頬が落込む
The cheeks fall in.
あの人は頬が落込んでいる、頬がこけている
His cheeks are sunken―He has hollow cheeks―He is hollow-cheeked―He has lantern-jaws.
頬をふくらす
to puff one's cheeks―(不機嫌でなら)―sulk
女は頬をふくらしている
She is sulky―in the sulks.
うまくて頬が落ちそうだ
It is delicious―goluptious.

content:
ほおかぶり〔頬被り〕
〈名〉Using a handkerchief as a hood:(=する) to hood one's head with a handkerchief

content.content: 頬かぶりした男
a man in a handkerchief

〈名〉A small red paper-lantern

content:

〈熟語〉To rest one's cheek on one's hand

content.content: 彼はほおづえをついてしきりに考えておった
He was thinking hard with his chin on his hand―with his head between his hands.

content:
ほおばる〔頬張る〕
〈自動〉To cram one's mouth ; to stuff one's mouth

content.content: 一口に頬張る
to cram all into one's mouth
頬張って食う
to cram one's mouth in eating
そのように頬張って食うものじゃない
You should not cram your mouth so when you eat.
彼は食物を頬張っている
He has his mouth full of food.
頬張りながら物を言う
to talk with one's mouth full

content:
ほおひげ〔頬髭〕
〈名〉Whiskers

content.content: 頬髭のある人
a whiskered man

content:
ほおぼね〔頬骨〕
〈名〉The cheek-bone

content.content: あの人は頬骨が高い
He has high cheek-bones.

content:
ほか〔外〕［注意］英語の名詞、形容詞、 副詞、前置詞、接続詞に相当す。
〈名〉The outside

content.content: ほかから来る
to come from the outside―come from without
ほかから来た人
an outsider

content:
〈形〉
1. (=の) other (単数は―another, some other, any other, no other―複数は―other, some other, any other, no other―名詞を省略すれば―others)

content.content: それじゃ(誰か)ほかの人に頼もう
Then I will ask another man―some other person―some one else.
誰かほかに心当りは無いか
Can't you think of any other person?―any one else?
誰もほかに心当たりは無い
I can think of no other person―no one else.
ほかに質問がありますか
Have you any other question to ask?
ほかの日にして下さい
Please choose some other day.
ほかの日ならいつでもよろしい
Any other day will do.
ほかの人達はどうしたか
What has become of the other men?―the others?
上衣とほか三品
a coat and three other articles
焼肉とほか二品
roast meat and two other dishes
田中君とほか二名
Mr. Tanaka and two others.
ほかに無い
no other―the only
世界中に通ずる国語は英語のほかに無い
No other language is spoken all over the world―English is the only language that is spoken all over the world.
僕の頼る人は君よりほかに無い
I have no other friend than you―I have no friend but you―You are my only friend.
このことのできる人は彼をおいてほかに無い
No other man can do this―He is the only man who can do this.
ほかにしかたがない
There is no other way―This is the only way―There is no other course―That is the only course open to me.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=に) else; otherwise［注意］“Else”は疑問代名詞、不定代名詞に伴って“other”に代わる。

content.content: ほかに誰が来るか
What other man is coming?―Who else is coming?
ほかに何が要るのか
What other things do you want?―What else do you want?
ほかに誰か来るのか
Is any other man coming?―Is any one else coming?
誰かほかの人に聞け
Ask someone other man―some one else.
何かほかに要るものがあるか
Do you want any other things?―anything else?
ほかに要るものがある
I want some other things―something else.
ほかに要るものは無い
I want nothing else.
ほかのことなら何でも致しますがそればかりはご免
I will do anything else―anything but that.
ほかに用がある
I have something else to do―I am otherwise engaged.
ほかに用が無かったらぜひ伺います
I will not fail to come if I am not otherwise engaged.
彼はなまけるだけでほかに非難すべき点は無い
He is only idle; he is not otherwise blameworthy.
彼の支度は襟飾りを着けないだけでほかに異状は無い
He wears no necktie, but is otherwise well-dressed.

content: 2. (=へ) elsewhere

content.content: それではどこかほかへ行こう
Then I will go somewhere else―elsewhere.
この品はほかで買うともっと安く買える
I can have the article cheaper elsewhere.
ほかを探したか
Have you looked for it elsewhere?
あれはほかから来た人だ
He comes from elsewhere.

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=は) but; except; excepting; excepted; with the exception of; save; beyond; outside

content.content: 病人は医者のほかは面会謝絶
The invalid sees no one but the doctor.
そのことのほかなら何でも致します
I will do anything but that.
あの先生のほかは皆知っている、教頭のほかは皆知っている
I know all the teachers but that one―all the teachers except the dean.
あの先生のほかは誰も知らぬ、教頭のほかは誰も知らぬ
I know none of the teachers but that one―none of the teachers except the dean.
靴のほかは登校を許さず
It is not allowed to enter the school except in shoes.
この事実のほかは何事も存ぜぬ
Excepting this fact,―With the exception of this fact,―Beyond this fact,―I know nothing.
彼自身の家族のほかは彼を知っている者が無い
Excepting his own family,―With the exception of his own family,―Outside his own family,―nobody knows him.
これは絵でほか見たことの無い奇観だ
I never saw such a strange sight except in pictures―save in pictures.
彼はなまけるほかは欠点が無い
He has no fault except idleness―He is faultless, except for his idleness―Excepting his idleness, he has no fault―He has no fault, his idleness excepted.
ほかは何々せぬ
only
僕は日曜のほかは外出せぬ
I do not go out except on Sunday―I go out only on Sunday.
彼は洋食のほかは食わぬ
He eats nothing but foreign food―He eats only foreign food.
英書のほかは読まぬ
He reads nothing but English books―He reads only English books.
彼は困った時のほかは来ない
He never comes except when he is in trouble―He comes only when he is in trouble.

content: 3. (=に、=にも) besides; in addition to; over and above

content.content: 手紙だけか、ほかに何かよこさなかったか
Did he give you anything beside the letter?
彼は俸給のほかに五六百円の収入がある
He has an income of five or six hundred besides his salary.
彼は英語教授のほかに著述に従事している
Besides teaching English,―In addition to teaching English,―he is engaged in literary work.
彼は不平のあるはずは無い、というのは彼が去る時、給料のほかにも礼まで出しておいたから
He can have nothing to complain of, for, when he left, I gave him something over and above what was due to him.

content: 〈接続詞〉(=は) unless

content.content: 病気のほかは決して学校を休むな
You must not absent yourself from school, unless you are ill.
彼は困った時のほかは決して来ない
He never comes except when he is in trouble.
何々するよりほかにしかたがない、ほかはない、ほかなし
There is no other way―There is no alternative―There is no help for it―There is nothing for it but to do so―I have no choice but to do so―I can not (choose) but do so―I must do so.
時機を待つよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to wait―There is no alternative but to wait―We have no choice but to wait―We must wait.
(そういう時は)逃げるよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to run―(より)―We must run for it.
こうなったら身を引くよりほかは無い
Under these circumstances, there is nothing for me but to resign―there is no course open to me but resignation―there is no alternative left me but resignation.
先方で要求に応じなけりゃ訴えるよりほかはない
If the other party will not comply with our demands, we have no choice but to proceed against them―we must bring an action against them.
(いくら)ほか無い
only
生徒は二三百ほか無い
They have only two or three hundred students―not more than two or three hundred students.
一つほか無いから上げられません
I can not give it you, for I have only one.
(何々に)ほかならず
nothing but―only
彼は一介の書生にほかならず
He is nothing but a student―He is only a student.
石炭は石の一種にほかならず
Coal is nothing but a kind of stone―Coal is only a kind of stone.
ほかならぬ(誰)
none other than―no less a personage than
ほかならぬ知事公のご依頼とあれば応ぜざるを得ぬ
Since it is no less a personage than the governor himself that makes the request, I think I must comply.
ほかならぬ君のお頼みだから一つ骨を折ってみよう
Since it is you and none other that asks the favour, I will do my best.
こう言ったのは家康その人にほかならぬ
It was no less a personage than Iyeyasu that said so.
ほかではない
only because
彼が働くのはほかではない働かざるを得ないからだ
He works, only because he must―simply because he can not but do so.
ほかでないが、ちと金の入用があって来た
The fact is, I wanted some money, and came to borrow it.
ほかの人ならともかくも君がそんなことをしてはおかしかろう
That you, of all men, should do such a thing!
ほかの日ならともかくも元旦早々強制執行とは
Of all the days in the year, a forcible execution on New Year's Day!
恋は思案のほか
“Love and reason do not go together.”

content:
ほかく〔捕獲〕
〈名〉Capture. seizure:(=する) to capture; to seize; to catch; to take

content.content: 軍艦を捕獲する
to capture a warship
捕獲物(捕獲軍艦など)
a prize―a lawful prize of war
(軍艦などを)正式に捕獲する(日章旗を掲げる)
to take possession of the prize
捕獲される
to be captured―become lawful prize
捕獲者
a captor
捕獲審検所
a prize-court
捕獲審検所評定官
an assessor

ほかく〔補角〕
〈名〉A supplementary angle

ほかけぶね〔帆掛け船〕
〈名〉A junk under sail; a sailing boat

content:
ほかける〔帆掛ける〕
〈自動〉To set sail

content.content: 追手に帆掛ける
to sail before the wind
尻に帆掛ける
to show one's heels―show a clean pair of heels―take to one's heels

content:
ぼかし〔暈し〕
〈名〉Shading; graduation

content.content: ぼかしの半身像
a vignette

content:
ぼかす〔暈す〕
〈他動〉To shade off (colour or light); to grade, gradate (colour); to vignette (a half-length photograph or portrait); to scumble (an oil-painting)

content.content: ぼかした半身像(または半身写真)
a vignette

content:
ポカポカ
〈形〉(=温か)warm:(=する) to feel warm; to glow

content.content: 日なたはポカポカする
It is warm in the sun.
顔がポカポカする
My face glows.
ポカポカ殴る
to pommel one―belabour one―give one a drubbing
ポカポカ歩く
to stroll―saunter

ほかほかする〔ホカホカする〕
〈自動〉To be warm; to glow

ほかほかする〔ホカホカする〕
〈自動〉To be warm; to glow

content:
ほがらか〔朗か〕
〈形〉Clear, serene (sky or weather); clear, clarion, sonorous (voice)

content.content: 朗らかな月
a serene moon
朗らかな声
a sonorous voice

content:
ほかん〔保管〕
〈名〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. Charge:(=する) to take charge of (valuables)

content.content: 私が貴重品を保管しよう
I will take charge of the valuables.
私が貴重品を保管している
I have charge of the valuables―I am in charge of the valuables.
貴重品は私が保管している
The valuables are in my charge―under my charge.
貴重品は亭主に保管さした
I gave the valuables in charge to the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に保管さしてある
The valuables are in the charge of the landlord―under the charge of the landlord.
亭主が貴重品を保管している
The landlord has charge of the valuables―The landlord is in charge of the valuables.
貴重品を保管している人
the man in charge of the valuables
その人の保管している貴重品
the valuables in the charge of―under the charge of―the man
保管物
goods in one's charge―goods under one's charge

content: 2. Custody:(=する) to take custody of (valuables); to take (valuables) into one's custody

content.content: 私が貴重品を保管しょう
I will take custody of the valuables―take the valuables into my custody.
私が貴重品を保管している
I have custody of the valuables―I am in custody of the valuables―I have the valuables in my custody.
貴重品は私が保管している
The valuables are in my custody.
貴重品は亭主に保管さした
I gave the valuables into the custody of the landlord―placed the valuables in the custody of the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に保管さしてある
The valuables are in the custody of the landlord.
亭主が貴重品を保管している
The landlord has custody of the valuables―The landlord is in custody of the valuables.
貴重品を保管している人
The man in custody of the valuables.
その人の保管している貴重品
the valuables in the custody of the man
保管物
an article in custody

content: 3. Keeping; safe-keeping:(=する) to keep (anything for another); to keep (treasure) safe

content.content: 私が貴重品を保管しよう
I will keep the valuables safe.
貴重品は私が保管している
The valuables are in my keeping―in my safe-keeping.
貴重品は保管さしてある
The valuables are in safe-keeping.
貴重品は亭主に保管さしてある
The valuables are in the safe-keeping of the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に保管さした
I gave the valuables into the safe-keeping of the landlord.

content: 4. Trust:(=する) to take (property) in trust

content.content: 私が財産を保管しよう
I will take the property in trust.
私が財産を保管している
I hold the property in trust.
彼が(死ぬ時)財産を弟に保管さした
He gave his property in trust―left his property in trust―to his brother.
相続人が成年するまで伯(叔)父が財産を保管している
The uncle holds the property in trust till the heir comes of age.
保管物
property in trust

content: 5. Deposit

content.content: 人の金を保管する
to hold money on deposit
金の保管を頼む
to deposit money with a man
保管金
money on deposit

content:
6. 
〈以上の共通点〉

content.content: 私が貴重品を保管しよう
I will keep the valuables safe―take charge of the valuables―take custody of the valuables―take the valuables into my custody.
私が貴重品を保管している
I have charge of―have custody of―the valuables―I am in charge of―in custody of―the valuables.
貴重品は私が保管している
The valuables are under my charge―in my charge―in my custody―in my safe-keeping.
貴重品を亭主に保管さした

I gave the valuables in charge of the landlord―gave the valuables into the custody of the landlord―placed the valuables in the custody of the landlord―placed the valuables in the safe-keeping of the landlord―gave the valuables into the safe-keeping of the landlord.
保管物
goods in one's charge―articles in custody―property in trust
保管人
a trustee (of property)―a custodian (of valuables)―a depositary (of money)
保管料(倉敷)
storage

content:
ぼかん〔母艦〕
〈名〉A depot-ship; a tender

content.content: 水雷母艦
a torpedo depot-ship
潜水艦母艦
a submarine-tender
飛行機母艦
a seaplance-tender

ポカン
〈間投詞〉Walker!; Hookey walker!

ほかんきん〔保管金〕
〈名〉Money on deposit

content:
ぽかんと〔ポカンと〕
〈副〉Vacantly; blankly; listlessly; absent-mindedly

content.content: ポカンとした顔
a vacant look―a blank look
ポカンとした顔をする
to look blank
ポカンとしたふう
a listless air
ポカンとして立っていた
He was standing with a vacant look―with a listless air.
一時間もポカンと待たされた
I was left to cool my heels for an hour.

content:
ぽかんと〔ポカンと〕
〈副〉Vacantly; blankly; listlessly; absent-mindedly

content.content: ポカンとした顔
a vacant look―a blank look
ポカンとした顔をする
to look blank
ポカンとしたふう
a listless air
ポカンとして立っていた
He was standing with a vacant look―with a listless air.
一時間もポカンと待たされた
I was left to cool my heels for an hour.

ほかんにん〔保管人〕
〈名〉A trustee (of property); a custodian (of valuables); a depositary (of money)

ほかんぶつ〔保管物〕
〈名〉Goods in one's charge; goods in custody; property in trust

ほかんりょう〔保管料〕
〈名〉Storage

content:
ぼき〔簿記〕
〈名〉Book-keeping

content.content: 簿記をつける
to keep books―keep accounts
簿記方

content: 2. (=心に誇る)to be proud of (one's birth); to be vain of (one's good looks); to take pride in (one's attainments); to pride oneself on, value oneself on, pique oneself on, plume oneself on, peacock oneself on (one's English); to stand on (one's wealth); to glory in (honest poverty); to make a merit of (an affair); to take credit to oneself for (having done something); to pretend to, lay claim to (some merit)

content.content: 彼は家柄を誇っている
He is proud of his birth.
彼は学問を誇っている
He takes a pride in his attainments.
あの人が学問を誇るのももっともだ
He may well be proud of his scholarship―He takes a just pride in his attainments.
あの人は英語を誇っているからおかしい
To think of his priding himself on his English!

A man should not stand on his riches.

He makes a merit of having done his duty―He takes credit to himself for having done his duty.
単に本分を尽くしただけでは誇るに足らぬ

僕の誇るところは勉強の一点である
