content.content: ボツボツ降り出した
It has begun raining a little.
ボツボツ始めようかな
Let us set to work at our leisure―weigh under easy sail.
(急ぐことは無い)ボツボツやってよい
You may proceed at your leisure.
(商売はご繁昌ですかと問われて)まあボツボツ
Only so so.
ボツボツとしみができた
It has got strained in blotches.

content:
ぼつぼつ〔勃々〕
〈形〉Rising, swelling (heart, valour, etc.)

content.content: 勇気勃々
to be valiant-looking―grim-looking
勇気勃々たる軍艦
a valiant warship―a grim warship
鋭気勃々
to be in exuberant spirits

content:
ポツポツ
〈名〉Dots; a dotted line
〈副〉In drops; drop by drop; little by little; by ones and twos; by twos and threes; here and there; at one's leisure; potteringly

content.content: ポツポツ降ってきた
It has begun falling in drops―begun to sprinkle.
人がポツポツ出てきた
People are turning out by ones and twos―by twos and threes.
氷屋がポツポツ見える
Ice-houses are to be seen here and there.
(ご繁昌ですかと問われて)まあポツポツ
How is your business doing?―Only so so.
ポツポツ仕事をする
to potter at one's work
ポツポツドイツ語をやっています
I am pottering at my German.
需要がポツポツある
There is a pottering demand.
ポツポツ註文が来る
There are pottering orders.
ポツポツ取りかかろう
Let us set to work at our leisure!―Let us weigh under easy sail!
(急ぐことはない)ポツポツでよい
You may proceed at our leisure.
ポツポツ参りましょう
Let's be jogging!
友人がポツポツやって来た
Some friends dropped in―blew in.

content:
ぽっぽと〔ポッポと〕
〈擬音詞〉
1. (The sound of) puffing

content.content: 機関車がポッポと湯気を吐く
The engine puffs out steam.
汽車がポッポと湯気を吐きながら停車場を出る
A train puffs out of the station.
顔がポッポとほてる
One's face glows.

content:
ぽっぽと〔ポッポと〕
〈擬音詞〉
1. (The sound of) puffing

content.content: 機関車がポッポと湯気を吐く
The engine puffs out steam.
汽車がポッポと湯気を吐きながら停車場を出る
A train puffs out of the station.
顔がポッポとほてる
One's face glows.

ぼつらく〔没落〕
〈名〉
1. (=滅亡)ruin; fall:(=する) to be ruined; to go to ruin; to fall
2. (=敗北、敗走)defeat; rout; flight:(=する) to be defeated; to sustain a defeat; to be routed; to fly
3. (=破産)bankruptcy:(=する) to become bankrupt

content:
ほつれる
〈自動〉(Cloth) frays; (hair) gets loose

content.content: 鬢のほつれを掻き上げる
to comb up the loose side-locks

content:
ほてい〔布袋〕
〈名〉One of the Seven Gods of Fortune (an old man with a pot-belly)

content.content: 布袋腹
a pot-belly―a paunch

ぼてふり〔棒手振り〕
〈名〉A hawker; a pedlar

content:
ボテボテ
〈副〉

content.content: ボテボテふとっている
to be corpulent

content:
ほてる
〈自動〉To burn; to feel hot

content.content: 耳がほてる
My ears tingle.
酒を飲んで顔がほてる
My cheeks are flushed with wine.

content:
ホテル
〈名〉A hotel

content.content: 彼は出京すると帝国ホテルに泊まる
When he comes to town, he puts up at the Imperial Hotel.

content:
ほど〔程〕
〈名〉
1. (=度合い) degree; extent

content.content: 親切を尽くすもよいがそれほどまでにしなくともよい
Kindness is all very well, but you need not go to that extent―go (to) that length―go so far.
あの人はおかしいほどていねいだ
He is polite to a ridiculous extent.
ばかばかしいほど几帳面だ
He is punctilious to an absurd extent.
気の毒なほど気がねする
He is afraid of giving trouble to a painful extent.
気の毒なほど行儀を崩さない
He is painfully proper.
日本は三十億ほどの公債を償還した
Japan has redeemed her public loan to the extent of―to the amount of―3,000,000,000 yen.
病人は眠れないほど苦しがる
The invalid suffers to such a degree that he can not sleep―so much that he can not sleep.
どれほど
To what extent?―To what degree?―How much?―How far?―How long?
君はどれほど借金があるか
What is the extent of your liabilities?―How much (or What) do you owe?
これほど
to this extent―to this degree―this much―thus much―so much
それほど、あれほど
to that extent―to that degree―that much―so much

content: 2. (=程合い)moderation; measure; bounds; limits

content.content: 程を計る、程にする
to use moderation―be moderate
何事も程にする
Do everything in moderation―in measure―within measure.
勉強も程を計ってするがよい
You ought to work in moderation―You ought to be moderate in working.
程に飲め
Drink in moderation―Be moderate in drinking.
程を守る
to observe moderation―keep within bounds
程を越す
to go beyond bounds―overstep the bounds―go too far―carry the matter too far―carry the matter to excess
何事も程を越すと害になる
If you go beyond bounds in doing anything, it will do you harm―Every success is a vice.
(たいていたいがいの)程を知れ
Keep within bounds―You should know where to draw the line―“The last drop makes the cup run over”―“The last straw breaks the camel's back.”
物には程がある
There are limits to everything.
冗談も程がある
There are limits to a man's patience―You carry your joke too far.
人をばかにするにも程がある
He shall know that I am not to be trifled with.
人をばかにするにも程がある、いったいぜんたいこれは何だ
What, in the name of all that is absurd, is this?
常識を欠くにも程がある、貴様のしたことはこれはいったい何だ
What, in the name of common sense, is this you have done?

content: 3. (=時)time

content.content: ほど経てまた行ってみた
I went again some time after―some while later.
ほど無く
soon―before long
ほど無く全快した
I soon got well―It was not long before I got well.
彼はほど無く全快するであろう
He will soon get well―He will get well before long―It will not be long before he gets well.
どれほど待ったか
How long have you been waiting?

content: 4. (=距離)distance

content.content: 停車場までどれほどあるか
What is the distance to the station?―How far is it to the station?
行くほども無く一人の旅人に出会った
I had not gone far before I met a traveller.

content: 5. (=気性)temper

content.content: あの人は程が好い、程の好い人だ
He is sweet-tempered―an amiable man―an agreeable man―a nice man.
みのほど〔身の程〕
どれほど
How much?
どれほど借金があるか
How much do you owe?―What do you owe?
どれほど時間がかかるか
How long does it take?
道程はどれほどあるか
How far is it?
長さがどれほどあるか
How long is it?―What is the length?
幅はどれほどあるか
How wide is it?―What is the breadth?
高さはどれほどあるか
How high is it?―What is the height?
深さはどれほどあるか
How deep is it?―What is the depth?
厚さはどれほどあるか
How thick is it?―What is the thickness?

content: 2. (=いくらほどの程)about

content.content: 十マイルほど来た
We have made about 10 miles―some ten miles.

content: 3. (=雪ほど白いの程)as... as...

content.content: この砂糖は雪ほど白い
This sugar is as white as snow.
彼らは瓜を二つに割ったほど似ている
They are as like as two peas.
月とスッポンほど違う
They are as like as chalk and cheese.
目は口ほどに物を言う
The eyes are as eloquent as the mouth―(と言うよりも)―The eyes are more eloquent than the mouth.

content: 4. (=雪ほどは白くないの程)not so... as...; less... than...

content.content: あの子は姉さんほど美しくない
She is not so beautiful as her sister―less beautiful than her sister.
試験は思ったほどむつかしくなかった
The examination was not so difficult as I had expected.
あの人は評判ほど悪くない
He is not so bad as he is reported to be―not so black as he is painted.
口ほど悪くない
He is not so black as he paints himself.
あなたはお年ほどに見えません
You do not look your age―You look young for your age―You wear well.

content: 5. (=雪ほど白いものは無いの程)(Nothing is) more... than...

content.content: 雪ほど白いものは無い
Nothing is so white as snow―(と言わずして)―Nothing is whiter than snow.
鳥の毛ほど軽いものは無い
Nothing is lighter than feather.
金剛石ほど堅いものは無い
Nothing is harder than diamond.
これほどたやすいことは無い、これほどわけの無いことは無い
Nothing is easier―Nothing can be simpler.
あれほど偉い人はない
There is no greater man than he―(と言うよりも)―He is the greatest man alive―He is the greatest man that ever lived.
日本ほど好い国は無い
There is no better country than Japan―(と言うよりも)―Japan is the best country in the world―Japan is the best land under the sun.
ばかほどこわいものは無い
Nothing can be more dreadful than a fool―A fool does not know what he is doing.
親ほどありがたいものは無い
No one is more deserving of gratitude than our parents―(西洋風に言えば)―Nothing can exceed parental love.
見るほど確かなことは無い
Nothing can be surer than seeing for oneself―“Seeing is believing.”

content: 6. (=泣くほど嬉しいの程)so... that; so... as to...; enough to...:(打消に伴えば)too... to...

content.content: 嬉し泣きに泣きたいほど嬉しかった
I was so glad that I cried for joy.
疲れるほど歩け
You must walk so much that you get tired―so much as to get tired―enough to make you tired.
彼はいやになるほど食う
He eats so much that he gets surfeited―so much as to surfeit him―enough to surfeit him.
(酒を飲むのはよいが)酔うほど飲んではいかん
You must not drink so much as to make you drunk.
時計が止まるほどの地震であった
The earthquake was so severe that the clocks stopped―so severe as to stop the clocks―severe enough to stop the clocks.
その光景は言うに言われぬほど美しい
The sight is so beautiful that it can not be described―too beautiful for words―beautiful beyond description.
あまり悲しくてかえって泣けないほど悲しい
I am so sad that I can not cry―I am too sad to cry―My sorrow is too deep for tears.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 死ぬほどくたびれた
I am tired to death.
あの時は死ぬほどびっくりした
I was frightened to death.
死ぬほど笑った
I nearly died with laughing.

content: 7. (=あればあるほどの程)the more..., the more..

content.content: 金はあればあるほど欲しくなる
The more money one has, the more one will want.
空中へ上がれば上がるほど寒くなる
The higher you go up into the air, the colder it becomes.
地下へ下がれば下がるほど熱くなる
The lower you go down into the earth, the hotter it becomes.
南の方へ行けば行くほど温かになる
The farther south you go, the warmer it becomes.
見れば見るほど美しい
The more I look at her, the more beautiful she looks.
考えれば考えるほどわからない
The more I think, the less I understand.［注意］この構文には省略構文多し。
ばかな子ほど可愛い
The greater the dunce (is), the dearer he is to his parents.
深くなるほど無分別
The deeper the love, the more indiscreet the lovers.
早けりゃ早いほど好い
The sooner, the better.
人数が多けりゃ多いほど面白い
The more, the merrier.

content: 〈以下代用構文〉

content.content: 忍耐すれば忍耐するほど成功する
The more you persevere, the better you will succeed―You will succeed in proportion as your persevere―Your success will be in proportion to your perseverance.
文明が進めば進むほど詩が衰える
The more civilized a people is, the less poetical it will become―(In proportion)as civilization advances, poetry will decline.

content: 8. (=何々しきれぬほどの程)more... than..

content.content: あの人は使いきれぬほど金がある
He has more money than he can spend.
読みきれないほど本を貰った
I have received more books than I can read.
うちの鶏は食いきれないほど卵を生む
Our hens lay more eggs than we can consume.

content: 9. (=いくらというほどの程)by(hundreds); by the(gallon, etc.)

content.content: 宅では日に何十というほどの卵を使います
We consume eggs by dozens every day.
何百羽というほど鴫を撃った
We shot snipe by hundreds.
何千というほどの人が集まった
People gathered by thousands of people gathered.
あの人は何升というほどの酒を飲む
He drinks wine by the gallon.
僕のところでは何トンというほどの石炭を炊く
We burn coal by the ton.
あんな人間は桝で量るほどある、箒で掃くほどある
Such men are to be found by the cartload.

content: 10. (=財産というほどの財産)(no property)worth mentioning, to speak of

content.content: あの人は財産というほどの財産は無い
He has no property worth mentioning―no property to speak of.
家は好い家だが庭というほどの庭が無い
The house is a good one, but there is no garden worth mentioning―no garden to speak of.
(庭はあるけれども)庭というほどの庭ではない
It is not much of a garden.
僕は蔵書というほどの蔵書はない
I have no library worth mentioning―no library to speak of.
蔵書というほどの蔵書ではない
It is not much of a library.
彼は取り立てて言うほどの作は無い
He has no works worth special mention.
英語の学校はあることはあるが学校というほどの学校でない
There is an English school, to be sure, but it is not much of a one.
公園と言えば公園だが公園というほどの公園ではない
You may call it a park, if you will, but it is not much of a one.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 勝利と敗北というほどの大差を生ずるものは最後の五分間である
It is the last five minutes that makes all the difference between victory and defeat.
成功と失敗というほどの大差をなすものはこの些細と言えば些細なことである
It is this trifle, if you will, that makes all the difference between success and failure.
我が家ほど好いところは無い
There is no place like home.
結果は予期したほどでない
The result falls short of our expectations.
君は見違えるほど変った
You have changed beyond recognition―I should not knew you if I met you in the streets―Your own mother would not know you.
御愛顧のほど奉願上候
We request you will favour us with your patronage―We solicit your patronage.
爪の垢ほど飲む
To take anything in minute quantities.
雀の涙ほどの火酒
a thimbleful of brandy
蛍ほどの火
a spark of fire
金はうなるほどある
He has a mint of money.
あの人は欲というものは塵ほども無い
He has not a particle of avarice in his nature.
棒ほど願って針ほど叶う
“Pray for a bludgeon, and you get a needle.”

content:
ボート
〈名〉A boat

content.content: ボートをこぐ
to row a boat
ボートを走らす
to sail a boat
ボートを下ろす
to lower a boat
ボートを吊る
to hoist a boat
ボート競走
a boat-race―a regatta
ボート掛け
davits
ボート台
a boat-rack

content:
ほどあい〔程合い〕
〈名〉
1. (=程度)degree; extent
2. (=適度)moderation; measure

content.content: 程合いを計る
to use moderation―be moderate―keep within bounds

ほどう〔歩道〕
〈名〉A foot-path; the side-walk

ぼどう〔母堂〕
〈名〉(A term of respect for another's) mother

content:
ほどく〔解く〕
〈他動〉To untie, unfasten, unknot(a string); to undo (a knot); to loose, loosen, unloose (a fastening); to disentangle, unravel (ravelled thread, etc.)

content.content: 結び目をほどく
to undo a knot―loose a fastening―unknot a string
紐をほどく
to untie the strings
靴の紐をほどく
to untie the lace―unlace the boots
包みをほどく
to untie a bundle
縫い目をほどく
to unstitch a seam
着物をほどく
to unsew a garment
荷造りをほどく
to unpack goods
靴下をほどく
to unknit a stocking―unravel a stocking
もつれをほどく
to disentangle (a thread)―unravel (a mystery)

content:
ほとけ〔仏〕
〈名〉
1. The Buddha:(に相当するは)a saint

content.content: 彼女の夫は仏様のような人だ
Her husband is a saint of a man.
仏の顔も三度(ということがある)
You are enough to provoke a saint.
知らぬが仏
“Ignorance is bliss.”
地獄で仏に逢ったよう
He was a friend in need.
仏作って魂入れず
to leave the body without the soul
神も仏も無いものか
Is there no God?
傀儡師首に
The puppet-player quaint―
掛けたる頭陀袋
His bag hangs from his neck;
仏出そうか
He can produce his saint
鬼を出そうか
Or devil at your beck

content: 2. (=死人)a dead person; the deceased

content.content: 仏になる
to die
仏様だ
He is dead.
仏に線香を立てる
to burn incense before the deceased

content:
ほどける〔解ける〕
〈自動〉To come untied; to get loose

content.content: 結び目がほどける
A knot comes untied.

content:
ほどこし〔施し〕
〈名〉Alms-giving; charity

content.content: 施しをする
to give alms―give in charity
施しを乞う
to beg for alms―solicit alms
施しを受ける
to receive alms
施しを受けて暮らす
to subsist on charity

content:
ほどこす〔施す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=施与する)to give alms(to the poor); to give (to the poor)in charity; to deal out (rice); to dispense (medicine)

content.content: 貧民に施す
to give alms to the poor―give to the poor in charity
米を施す
to deal out rice
薬を施す
to dispense medicine

content: 2. (=施行する)to do (one justice); to administer (justice, punishment, etc.)

content.content: 恩恵を施す
to do one a favour―grant one a favour―bestow a favour on one
己の欲するところ人にもこれを施せ
“Do to others as you would have others do to you”―“Do to others as you would be done by.”

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 手術を施す
to perform an operation on a subject―operate upon a subject
治療を施す
to subject a patient to treatment―treat a patient
肥料を施す
to manure a field―dress a garden―fertilize the soil
策を施す
to take measure―take steps
策の施すところを知らず、策の施しようが無い、施すべき策無し
I am at a loss how to net―at the end of my resources―at my wits' end.
面目を施す
to redound to one's honour ―do one honour ―do one credit
彼は手柄をして大いに面目を施した
His deed redounds greatly to his honour―does him great credit.
彼の成功は一家に面目を施す
His success reflects credit on his family.
仁政を施す
to rule benignly over the people
悪政を施す
to misgovern―misrule―a country
防備を施す
to fortify a town
註釈を施す
to annotate the text―add explanatory notes to the text
傍註を施す
to add margin-notes to the text

ほどちかき〔程近き〕
〈形〉Near; not far from(some place)

content:
ほどとおからぬ〔程遠からぬ〕
〈形〉Not far from; near(some place)

content.content: ほど遠からぬところに神社がある
Not far from here is a shrine.

content:
ほととぎす〔時鳥〕
〈名〉The (Japanese) cuckoo

content.content: 時節を待てよ時鳥
The cuckoo will sing in due season.
時鳥鳴きつる
The cuckoo sings his thrilling tune―
方を見渡せば
My eye doth sweep the scene,
只有明の
And only see the waning moon
月ぞ残れる
Hang lonesome and serene.

content:
ほどなく〔程無く〕
〈副〉Soon; before long

content.content: 程無く機会があった
An opportunity soon presented itself―It was not long before an opportunity presented itself.
彼も程無く全快するであろう
He will soon be well―He will get well before long―It will not be long before he gets well.
待つ程無く彼が来た
I had not waited long before he appeared.

content:
ほどに〔程に〕
〈副〉Moderately; in moderation; within bounds

content.content: 程に飲め
Drink in moderation―Be moderate in drinking.
勉強も程にするが好い
You ought to work in moderation―be moderate in working.
何事も程にせよ
Use moderation―Be moderate―Keep within bounds.

content:
ほとばしる〔迸る〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ほどばしる〔迸る〕

content:
ほどばしる〔迸る〕
〈自動〉To spout; to spirt; to spurt; to gush out

content.content: 岩間より水がほどばしる
Water gushes out of the rock.
切り口から血がほどばしる
Blood spouts from the wound―spurts from the wound.
肉飛び血ほどばしる光景
a scene of carnage

content:
ほとほと
〈副〉Almost; well nigh

content.content: ほとほと困っている
I am well nigh at my wits' end―well nigh in despair.

content:
ポトポト
〈擬音詞〉→『

content.content: ポタポタ

content:
ほとぼり
〈名〉
1. Warmth

content.content: この寝床に寝た者がある、まだほとぼりがある
The bed has been slept in, it is still warm.

content: 2. (=世間の評判)the talk of the town

content.content: ほとぼりが冷めるまで姿を隠せ
Keep out of sight till the storm blows over.
ほとぼりが冷めるまで待て
Wait till the affair blows over.
ほとぼりを冷まして帰れ
Return after the affair has blown over.

content:
ほどよい〔程好い〕
〈形〉Moderate(industry); modest(demands); judicious (treatment); proper, right, good (place or time)

content.content: 程よい要求だろう
These are moderate demands―modest demands.
(寛厳よろしきを得て)程よい取扱い
judicious treatment
程よい時に合図する
I will give the signal in good time―at the right moment.
程よい返事をしておけ
Give an evasive answer―Make a non-committal reply.

content:
ほとり〔辺〕
〈名〉Neighbourhood; vicinity; the banks (of a river)

content.content: 隅田のほとりに住居する
to live on the banks of the Sumida

content:
ほとる
〈自動〉To feel warm; to glow

content.content: 水浴をすると身体がポッポとほとる
You feel a glow after taking a cold bath.

content:
ほとんど〔殆ど〕
〈副〉
1. (=約)about; some; in the neighbourhood of; in the vicinity of; in the region of; in round numbers

content.content: 生徒の数は殆ど五千
The number of student is about 5,000―some 5,000―in the neighbourhood of 5,000―5,000 in round numbers.

content: 2. (=略)nearly; almost; all but; nigh upon; well nigh; little short of

content.content: 普請は殆どでき上がった
The building is nearly finished―almost finished―all but finished.
彼が助かったのは殆ど奇蹟だ
His escape is little short of a miracle.
時は殆ど十二時
It is nigh upon twelve―on the stroke of twelve.
殆どおしまいだ
It is very nigh over.
殆ど無い
There is little―little, if any―scarcely any―hardly any―next to none.［注意］打消には“nearly”又は“almost”を用いず。
殆ど疑い無し
There is little doubt about it.
殆ど見込無し
There is little hope―little, if any, hope―scarcely any hope.
殆ど言うに及ばぬ
I need scarcely say.
彼が家にいることは殆ど無い
He is scarcely ever―hardly ever―at home.
得るところ殆ど無し
I gained scarcely anything―next to nothing.
それは殆ど不可能である
It is hardly possible―next to impossible.
殆ど同じ
much the same
殆どそのよう
much such
君と僕は殆ど同じ境遇だ
You and I are in much the same situation.
殆どそのような境遇に立っている
I am in much such a situation.
待遇は罪人と殆ど同然だ
They treat me much as if I were a criminal.
彼らは殆ど同年輩だ
They are very much of an age.
殆ど同じ背格好だ
They are very much of a size.

content: 〈代用動詞〉To border on, verge on (some state); to amount almost to (something)

content.content: 彼が助かったのは殆ど奇蹟だ
His escape borders on the miraculous.
彼は殆ど詐欺に近い手段を用いる
He resorts to means bordering on fraud―verging on fraud.
彼らの熱心は殆ど発狂に近い
Their zeal verges on madness.
彼らの信仰は殆ど迷信に近い
Their faith verges on superstition.
彼の歎願は殆ど脅迫に近い
His request amounts almost to a threat.

content: 〈特例〉

content.content: あの先生は教科書を殆ど暗記している
He has the text-books at his fingers' ends.

content:
ほなみ〔穂波〕
〈名〉The waving of rice-ears

content.content: 風が吹くと穂波が打つ
The rice-ears wave in the wind.

content:
ほにゅう〔哺乳〕
〈名〉Lactation:(=する) to suckle (the young)

content.content: 哺乳類
Mammalia

content:
ぼにゅう〔募入〕
〈名〉Raising, flotation (of a loan)

content.content: 募入公債
the loan floated
募入額
the amount raised

content:
ぼにゅう〔母乳〕
〈名〉Mother's milk

content.content: 子どもを育てるには母乳に越すものは無い
It is best to feed a child on mother's milk―to rear a child at the breast.

ほにゅうどうぶつ〔哺乳動物〕
〈名〉A mammal

content:
ほね〔骨〕
〈名〉
1. A bone:(骸骨)a skeleton:(軟骨)cartilage

content.content: 骨だらけ
bony
これは骨の多い魚だ
This is a bony fish.
骨ごと食べる
You can eat it bone and all.
骨をしゃぶる
to pick bones
骨に近いほど肉がうまい
“The nearer the bone, the sweeter the flesh.”
喉に骨が立った
A bone sticks in my throat.
喉に骨を引っかけた
I have a bone in my throat.
骨が一本折れた
A bone is broken.
骨は折れておらぬ
No bones are broken.
骨を接ぐ
to set a (broken) bone
骨を違える、骨をくじく
to dislocate a bone―put a bone out of joint
彼は骨と皮ばかりになっている
He is all skin and bones―a bag of bones―reduced to a skeleton―worn to a shadow.
病気して骨と皮ばかりになった
Illness has reduced him to a skeleton.
明け方の寒さが骨に徹する
The chill of morning penetrates to the bone.
両犬骨を争えば第三犬これを奪い去る
When two dogs fight for a bone, a third dog runs away with it.
彼はまだ骨が固まらない
He is still in the gristle.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼の講話が骨に染みた
His lecture has come home to my heart―I am deeply impressed with his lecture.
俺が骨を拾ってやる
I will take care of your remains―look after your remains.
役人の骨を拾う
to employ a dismissed official
どこの馬の骨やら
He is God knows who―(女なら)―She is no better than she ought to be.
骨を折る
to take pains―take trouble―make efforts―use endeavours―exert oneself―labour
一つ骨を折ってみよう
I will see what I can do(for you).
骨を折った甲斐が無かった
I have laboured in vain.
骨を折った甲斐があった
I have not laboured in vain―I have laboured to some purpose―My labours are crowned with success.
彼は今度の著述にはだいぶ骨を折ったらしい
He seems to have taken great pains over his new work.
一つお骨折りが願いたい
I wish you would exert yourself in my behalf―use your influence in my behalf.
先生の教え方が好いから生徒は骨を折らずに覚える
He teaches with such tact that the students learn without effort.
あの女は俺に骨を折らせあがった
She has cost me trouble―led me a pretty dance.
骨が折れる
It is hard work―much trouble.
英語を教えるのは骨が折れる
It is hard work to teach English.
始めは骨が折れるがじきに慣れる
You find it hard work at first, but you soon get used to it.
本を書くのは骨が折れる
It is much trouble to write a book.
学校をあれだけにするにはだいぶ骨が折れたろう
It must have cost him much trouble―cost him much labour―to make the school what it is.
漢字は学ぶに骨が折れる
Chinese characters are hard to learn―troublesome to learn.
借金をしまいと思うと骨が折れる
I have much to do―much ado to keep out of debt.
(あまりおかしくて)笑わずにいるのに骨が折れた
I had much ado to keep my countenance.
これは骨の折れる仕事だ
This is a laborious task―a toilsome task―an arduous task―a tough job.
骨の折れない仕事は無いか
Isn't there an easy task?―a light task?―a soft job?
骨の折れる問題
a stiff problem
これからが骨だ
Now comes the hardest part of the work.
骨を惜む
to spare oneself―be sparing of oneself
骨を惜しまぬ
to spare no pains
彼は骨を惜しまずよく働く
He is not sparing of himself.
骨を休める
to rest oneself after one's labours―rest one's wearied limbs
骨休め
a well-earned rest

content: 6. (=気骨)spirit; soul

content.content: あれはちょっと骨のある男だ
He is a man of spirit―a staunch fellow.
骨無しだ
He has no spirit―no soul―no backbone.

content: 7. (障子などの骨)a frame:(家や船などの骨) framework:(傘の骨)ribs:(扇子や団扇の骨)ribs; sticks

ほねおしみ〔骨惜み〕
〈名〉(事)laziness; sluggishness:(人)a sluggard; a lazy fellow

content.content: 骨惜しみをする
to spare oneself―be sparing of oneself
骨惜しみをせぬ
to spare no pains
彼は骨惜しみをせずによく働く
He spares no pains―He is not sparing of himself.

content:
ほねおり〔骨折り〕
〈名〉Pains; efforts; endeavours; exertions; labours; toil; trouble

content.content: 一つお骨折りを願いたい
I wish you would exert yourself in my behalf―use your influence in my behalf.
お骨折りの報酬は致します
I will recompense you for your labours―pay you for your trouble.
骨折り甲斐がある
It is well worth the trouble.
骨折り甲斐が無い
It is not worth the trouble.
骨折り甲斐が無かった
I have laboured in vain.
骨折り甲斐があった
I have not laboured in vain―I have laboured to some purpose―My labours are crowned with success.
富士登山は骨折り甲斐がある
The ascent of Fuji repays the trouble.
せっかくの骨折りが水の泡
All my efforts have come to naught.
これは骨折り仕事だ
This is a laborious task―a toilsome task―an arduous task―a tough job.
骨折り損、無駄骨折り
lost labour

content:
ほねおりぞん〔骨折り損〕
〈名〉Lost labour

content.content: 骨折り損をした
I got nothing for my pains.
そんなことをしては骨折り損だ
You will only get laughed at for your pains―You will be a fool for your pains.
骨折り損のくたびれ儲けだ
It is only so much labour lost.

content:
ほねおりちん〔骨折り賃〕
〈名〉A recompense for one's labours

content.content: 骨折り賃をいくらやろうか
What shall I pay him for his trouble?
骨折り賃に若干の金をやった
I gave him something for his trouble.
これは少ないが骨折り賃
Here is a trifle for your trouble―Here is something for your trouble.

ほねがらみ〔骨絡み〕
〈名〉Constitutional syphilis

content:
ほねぐみ〔骨組〕
〈名〉
1. (=骨の組立て)framework; skeleton; carcase

content.content: 家や船の骨組
the framework―the skeleton―the carcase―of a house or a ship

content: 2. (=体格)frame; physique; build

content.content: 骨組のしっかりした男だ
He is a man of strong build―a stout-built man.
か弱い骨組
a delicate frame

ほねちがい〔骨違い〕
〈名〉Dislocation:(=する) to dislocate a bone; to put a bone out of joint

ほねつぎ〔骨接ぎ〕
〈名〉
1. (=接骨術)bone-setting
2. (=接骨医)a bone-setter

content:
ほねなし〔骨無し〕
〈名〉A spiritless man

content.content: あの男は骨無しだ
He has no spirit―no soul―no backbone.

content:
ほねぬき〔骨抜き〕
〈名〉Boned fish

content.content: 骨抜きどじょう
boned loaches
それでは議案が骨抜きになる
The bill would become mutilated―eviscerated―emasculated.

ほねぬきあん〔骨抜き案〕
〈名〉A mutilated bill; an eviscerated bill; an emasculated bill

content:
ほねぶし〔骨節〕
〈名〉A joint

content.content: 身体中の骨節が痛む
All my joints pain me―I feel a pain in all my joints.

content:
ほねみ〔骨身〕
〈名〉

content.content: 骨身にこたえる
(心魂に徹するの意味なら)to come home to one's heart―(骨髄に徹するの意味なら)―penetrate to one's heart―cut one to the heart
彼の親切が骨身にこたえた
His kindness came home to my heart.
恥をかかされて骨身にこたえた
The insult has cut me to the heart―I am penetrated with resentment.
彼は骨身を惜しまず働く
He is not sparing of himself.

content:
ほねやすめ〔骨休め〕
〈名〉Well-earned rest; relaxation

content.content: 骨休めをする
to rest oneself after one's labours―rest one's wearied limbs―unbend oneself

content:
ほのお〔焔〕
〈名〉A flame

content.content: 焔が立つ
to blaze
家は炎々たる焔に包まれた
The house was enveloped in flames―in a blaze.
胸の焔
the flame of passion
恋の焔
the passion of love

content:
ほのかに〔仄かに〕
〈副〉Faintly; dimly

content.content: そんなことをほのかに聞いていた
I had an inkling of the fact.
ほのかに聞かしておいた
I gave him an inkling of the fact.
ほのかに聞くところによれば彼は辞職するそうだ
It has come to my ears that he is going to resign.
ほのかに承れば教員ご入用の由
You are in want of teacher, I understand.

content:
ほのぐらい〔仄暗い〕
〈形〉Dusky; gloomy; sombre

content.content: まだほの暗いうちに家を出た
I left home in the gray of the morning.

content:
ほのぼのと〔仄々と〕
〈副〉Faintly; dimly

content.content: 夜はほのぼのと明け渡る
Morning is dawning.
事実がほのぼのと胸に浮かんだ
The truth dawned upon my mind.

content:
ほのめかす〔仄かす〕
〈他動〉To hint (at or that...); to suggest; to insinuate; to intimate (to one that...); to give (one) an inkling of (a fact)

content.content: 彼は辞職の意をほのめかした
He hinted that he would resign―hinted at resignation.
彼らは要求を容れなければ総辞職をするようなことを暗にほのめかした
They darkly hinted that they would resign in a body―obscurely hinted at general resignation―dropped a dark hint about general resignation―if their demands were not complied with.
彼は不承諾の意を僕にほのめかしている
He intimates to me that he will not consent.
彼は何か不平があるようなことをほのめかしている
He insinuates that he is dissatisfied with something.
彼に事実をほのめかしておいた
I gave him an inkling of the fact.

content:
ほのめく〔仄く〕
〈自動〉To appear faintly

content.content: その顔には堅い決心の色がほのめいていた
A firm resolution betrayed itself in his countenance.

content:
ほばく〔捕縛〕
〈名〉Apprehension; arrest :(=する) to apprehend, arrest, take(a thief); to place (a suspect) under arrest

content.content: 犯人はまだ捕縛にならぬ
The culprit is still at large.

content:
ほばしら〔檣〕
〈名〉A mast

content.content: 三本檣の船
a three-masted vessel―a three-sticker
檣に登る
to go aloft
船が檣を失う
A ship loses her masts.―A ship is dismasted.
檣を失った船
a dismasted ship

content:
ほばしる〔帆走る〕
〈自動〉To sail

content.content: 船が帆走っている
A ship is sailing―under sail.

content:
ぼひ〔墓碑〕
〈名〉A gravestone; a tombstone

content.content: 墓碑を建てる
to erect a tombstone
親の墓碑を建てた
I erected a gravestone to my father's memory.

content:
ほひつ〔補弼〕
〈名〉Assistance:(=する) to assist (the Emperor)

content.content: 国務大臣は天皇を補弼す
The Ministers of State assist and advise the Emperor.

ぼひょう〔墓表〕
〈名〉An inscription on a tombstone; an epitaph

content:
ほぶ〔歩武〕
〈名〉Pace

content.content: 歩武を進める
to proceed―progress

ほふくする〔匍匐する〕
〈自動〉To creep; to crawl

ほふる〔屠る〕
〈他動〉To butcher, slaughter (cattle); to slaughter(the enemy); to massacre (people)

content:
ほへい〔歩兵〕
〈名〉An infantryman; a foot-soldier:(集合的に言えば) infantry; foot(=foot-soldiers―の略)

content.content: 五千の歩兵
5,000 foot―5,000 rifles―5,000 bayonets
一万の歩兵と五千の騎兵よりなる一軍
an army consisting of 10,000 foot and 5,000 horse―10,000 rifles and 5,000 sabres
歩兵中隊
a company
歩兵第五十連隊
the 50th (Regiment of) Foot
歩兵大尉
a captain of foot
歩兵戦
an infantry action
歩兵突貫
an infantry charge
歩兵銃
a rifle
歩兵科
the infantry arm
乗馬歩兵
mounted infantry

ホーホー
〈擬音詞〉(=梟のホーホー)Tu-wit tu-whoo

content:
ほぼ〔保母〕
〈名〉A nurse; a dry-nurse; a nursery governess

content.content: 幼稚園の保母
a kinder-gartener

content:
ほぼ〔略〕
〈副〉Almost; nearly

content.content: 工事はほぼ完成した
The works are nearly completed.
後任はほぼ決定している
My successor is almost decided upon.
結果はほぼ同じだ
The results are much the same.
ほぼわかりました
I understand, though not quite.

ほまえせん〔帆前船〕
〈名〉A sailing-ship; a sailing-vessel

content:
ほまち
〈名〉Perquisites

content.content: ほまち仕事
a side-job

content:
ほまれ〔誉〕
〈名〉Honour; credit; glory; praise

content.content: 誉れとなる
to redound to one's honour―do one honour―do one credit―to be to one's honour―do one's credit
あのようなことをすれば身の誉れとなる
Such conduct does him honour.
誉れとする
to consider it an honour
これは身の誉れです
I esteem it an honour.
あのような人は国の誉れだ
Such a man is an honour to his country.
あのような息子は家の誉れだ
Such a son is a credit to his family―Such a boy reflects credit on his family.

ほむべき〔誉むべき〕
〈形〉Worthy of praise; deserving of praise; praiseworthy; commendable; laudable

ほめそやす〔誉めそやす〕
〈他動〉To extol (one) to the skies; to laud (me) to the echo

ほめたたえる〔誉め称える〕
〈他動〉To celebrate (one's deeds in song)

content:
ほめたてる〔誉め立てる〕
〈他動〉To cry (one) up; to sing one's praises; to chant one's praises; to extol (one) to the skies; to laud (one) to the echo

content.content: 新聞が彼を誉め立てた
The papers wrote him up.
皆口を極めて彼を誉め立てている
They are loud in his praise―warm in his praise.

ほめちぎる〔誉めちぎる〕
〈他動〉To extol (one) to the skies; to laud (one) to the echo

content:
ほめる〔誉める〕
〈他動〉To praise (one for one's diligence); to compliment (one on one's performance); to applaud, commend, extol, laud, approve, approbate (a man or his performance); to speak well of, speak highly of, speak in high terms of (a man); to have a good opinion of (a man)

content.content: 大将が部下の勇敢を誉めた
The general praised the bravery of his men―(は散文体、談話体では)―praised his men for their bravery.
彼の勉強を誉めてやった
I praised his diligence―praised him for his diligence.
彼の手際を誉めた
I complimented him on his performance.
皆今度の先生をたいそう誉めている
They speak highly of the new man―speak of him in high terms..
彼の新作を世間で誉めている
His new work is applauded by the public.
あの人に誉められると後がこわい
When he praises you, he has some end in view.
誉める人に油断すな
Beware of the man who praises you.
品物を誉めた人に買ったためし無し
The man who praised the article, was never known to buy.
面と向かって誉める人に限って蔭で悪口を言う
One who praises you to your face, is sure to speak ill of you behind your back.
彼の処置は誉むるに言葉無し
His conduct is above praise.
あまり誉めた話じゃない
It is not much to be commended.
あまり誉めた人間じゃない
He has not much to recommend him.
あまり誉めた文章じゃない
I can't say much for his style.
彼は惜しまず人を誉める
He is lavish of praise.
控え目に人を誉める
He is chary of praise―He bestows praise with a sparing hand.
あの人はあまり人を誉めない
He damns with faint praise.
お誉めにあずかる
to meet with one's approbation
お誉めにあずかって痛み入る
I am obliged to you for your good opinion.
彼はどう賞めても勉強家とばかりは言えぬ
Whatever you may say of him, you can not say that he is diligent―He is anything but diligent.

ぼや〔小火〕
〈名〉A small fire; an incipient fire
